"[50-martha]

" Oh ! "[38-mary] cried [Mary]38-mary , " is [he]41-mr. craven going away tomorrow ? [I]38-mary am so glad ! "[38-mary]

" [He]41-mr. craven 's goin' for a long time . [He]41-mr. craven may n't come back till autumn or winter . [He]41-mr. craven 's goin' to travel in [foreign places]2393-foreign places . [He]41-mr. craven 's always doin' it . "[50-martha]

" Oh ! [I]38-mary 'm so glad so glad ! "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary thankfully .

If [he]831-he did not come back until winter , or even autumn , there would be time to watch [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden come alive . Even if [he]831-he found out then and took it away from [her]38-mary [she]38-mary would have had that much at least .

" When do [you]45-mrs. medlock think [he]831-he will want to see "[831-he]

[She]38-mary did not finish the sentence , because the door opened , and [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock walked in . [She]45-mrs. medlock had on [her]45-mrs. medlock best black dress and cap , and [her]45-mrs. medlock collar was fastened with a large brooch with a picture of [a man]1910-a man 's face on it . It was a colored photograph of [Mr. Medlock]79-mr. medlock who had died years ago , and [she]45-mrs. medlock always wore it when [she]45-mrs. medlock was dressed up . [She]45-mrs. medlock looked nervous and excited .

" [Your]45-mrs. medlock hair 's rough , "[45-mrs. medlock] [she]45-mrs. medlock said quickly . " Go and brush it . [Martha]50-martha , help [her]45-mrs. medlock to slip on [her]45-mrs. medlock best dress . [Mr. Craven]41-mr. craven sent [me]45-mrs. medlock to bring [her]45-mrs. medlock to [him]41-mr. craven in [[his]41-mr. craven study]2394-his study . "[45-mrs. medlock]

All the pink left [Mary]38-mary 's cheeks . [Her]38-mary heart began to thump and [she]38-mary felt [herself]38-mary changing into [a stiff , plain , silent child]834-a stiff , plain , silent child again . [She]45-mrs. medlock did not even answer [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock , but turned and walked into [[her]45-mrs. medlock bedroom]835-her bedroom , followed by [Martha]50-martha . [She]45-mrs. medlock said nothing while [her]45-mrs. medlock dress was changed , and [her]45-mrs. medlock hair brushed , and after [she]45-mrs. medlock was quite tidy [she]45-mrs. medlock followed [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock down [the corridors]836-the corridors , in silence . What was there for [her]45-mrs. medlock to say ? [She]45-mrs. medlock was obliged to go and see [Mr. Craven]41-mr. craven and [he]41-mr. craven would not like [her]45-mrs. medlock , and [she]45-mrs. medlock would not like [him]41-mr. craven . [She]45-mrs. medlock knew what [he]41-mr. craven would think of [her]45-mrs. medlock .

[She]45-mrs. medlock was taken to [a part of [the house]166-the house [she]45-mrs. medlock had not been into before]837-a part of the house she had not been into before . At last [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock knocked at a door , and when [some one]151-some one said , " Come in , "[151-some one] [they]840-they entered [the room]201-the room together . [A man]1910-a man was sitting in an armchair before the fire , and [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock spoke to [him]1910-a man .

" This is [Miss Mary]38-mary , [sir]2395-sir , "[45-mrs. medlock] [she]45-mrs. medlock said .

" [You]2395-sir can go and leave [her]38-mary here . [I]41-mr. craven will ring for [you]2395-sir when [I]41-mr. craven want [you]2395-sir to take [her]38-mary away , "[41-mr. craven] said [Mr. Craven]41-mr. craven .

When [she]45-mrs. medlock went out and closed the door , [Mary]38-mary could only stand waiting , a plain little thing , twisting [her]38-mary thin hands together . [She]38-mary could see that [the man in the chair]843-the man in the chair was not so much a hunchback as [a man with high , rather crooked shoulders]844-a man with high , rather crooked shoulders , and [he]1910-a man had black hair streaked with white . [He]1910-a man turned [his]1910-a man head over [his]1910-a man high shoulders and spoke to [her]38-mary .

" Come here ! "[1910-a man] [he]1910-a man said .

[Mary]38-mary went to [him]1910-a man .

[He]1910-a man was not ugly . [His]1910-a man face would have been handsome if it had not been so miserable . [He]1910-a man looked as if the sight of [her]38-mary worried and fretted [him]1910-a man and as if [he]1910-a man did not know what in [the world]234-the world to do with [her]38-mary .

" Are [you]38-mary well ? "[1910-a man] [he]1910-a man asked .

" Yes , "[38-mary] answered [Mary]38-mary .

" Do [they]2396-they take good care of [you]1910-a man ? "[1910-a man]

" Yes . "[1910-a man]

[He]1910-a man rubbed [his]1910-a man forehead fretfully as [he]1910-a man looked [her]38-mary over .

" [You]38-mary are very thin , "[1910-a man] [he]1910-a man said .

" [I]38-mary am getting fatter , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary answered in what [she]38-mary knew was [her]38-mary stiffest way .

What an unhappy face [he]1910-a man had ! [His]1910-a man black eyes seemed as if they scarcely saw [her]38-mary , as if [they]846-they were seeing something else , and [he]1910-a man could hardly keep [his]1910-a man thoughts upon [her]38-mary .

[She]50-martha ran as quickly as [she]50-martha could to [the garden]146-the garden . " [I]857-they will cum bak . "[857-they]

CHAPTER XIII

" [I]38-mary AM [COLIN]81-colin "[38-mary]

[Mary]38-mary took the picture back to [the house]166-the house when [she]38-mary went to [her]38-mary supper and [she]38-mary showed it to [Martha]50-martha .

" Eh ! "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha with great pride . " [I]50-martha never knew [[our]2442-our [Dickon]54-dickon]1929-our dickon was as clever as that . That there 's a picture of a missel thrush on [her]1929-our dickon nest , as large as life an ' twice as natural . "[50-martha]

Then [Mary]38-mary knew [Dickon]54-dickon had meant the picture to be a message . [He]54-dickon had meant that [she]38-mary might be sure [he]54-dickon would keep [her]38-mary secret . [[Her]38-mary garden]1960-her garden was [her]38-mary nest and [she]38-mary was like [a missel thrush]2373-a missel thrush . Oh , how [she]38-mary did like [that queer , common boy]861-that queer , common boy !

[She]38-mary hoped [he]861-that queer , common boy would come back the very next day and [she]38-mary fell asleep looking forward to the morning .

But [you]862-you never know what the weather will do in [Yorkshire]50-martha , particularly in the springtime . [She]38-mary was awakened in the night by the sound of rain beating with heavy drops against [her]38-mary window . It was pouring down in torrents and the wind was " wuthering "[38-mary] round the corners and in [the chimneys of [the huge old house]864-the huge old house]863-the chimneys of the huge old house . [Mary]38-mary sat up in bed and felt miserable and angry .

" The rain is as contrary as [I]38-mary ever was , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " It came because it knew [I]38-mary did not want it . "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary threw [herself]38-mary back on [her]38-mary pillow and buried [her]38-mary face . [She]38-mary did not cry , but [she]38-mary lay and hated the sound of the heavily beating rain , [she]38-mary hated the wind and its " wuthering . "[38-mary] [She]38-mary could not go to sleep again . The mournful sound kept [her]38-mary awake because [she]38-mary felt mournful [herself]38-mary . If [she]38-mary had felt happy it would probably have lulled [her]38-mary to sleep . How it " wuthered "[38-mary] and how the big raindrops poured down and beat against the pane !

" It sounds just like [a person lost on the moor and wandering on and on crying]2444-a person lost on the moor and wandering on and on crying , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said .

[She]38-mary had been lying awake turning from side to side for about an hour , when suddenly something made [her]38-mary sit up in bed and turn [her]38-mary head toward the door listening . [She]38-mary listened and [she]38-mary listened .

" It is n't the wind now , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said in a loud whisper . " That is n't the wind . It is different . It is that crying [I]38-mary heard before . "[38-mary]

The door of [[her]38-mary room]1871-her room was ajar and the sound came down [the corridor]583-the corridor , a far - off faint sound of fretful crying . [She]38-mary listened for a few minutes and each minute [she]38-mary became more and more sure . [She]38-mary felt as if [she]38-mary must find out what it was . It seemed even stranger than [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden and the buried key . Perhaps the fact that [she]38-mary was in a rebellious mood made [her]38-mary bold . [She]38-mary put [her]38-mary foot out of bed and stood on the floor .

" [I]38-mary am going to find out what it is , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " [Everybody]185-everybody is in bed and [I]38-mary do n't care about [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock [I]38-mary do n't care ! "[38-mary]

There was a candle by [her]38-mary bedside and [she]38-mary took it up and went softly out of [the room]201-the room . [The corridor]583-the corridor looked very long and dark , but [she]38-mary was too excited to mind that . [She]38-mary thought [she]38-mary remembered the corners [she]38-mary must turn to find [the short corridor]870-the short corridor with the door covered with tapestry the one [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock had come through the day [she]38-mary lost [herself]38-mary . The sound had come up that passage . So [she]38-mary went on with [her]38-mary dim light , almost feeling [her]38-mary way , [her]38-mary heart beating so loud that [she]38-mary fancied [she]38-mary could hear it . The far - off faint crying went on and led [her]38-mary . Sometimes it stopped for a moment or so and then began again . Was this the right corner to turn ? [She]38-mary stopped and thought . Yes it was . Down [this passage]871-this passage and then to the left , and then up two broad steps , and then to the right again . Yes , there was the tapestry door .

[She]38-mary pushed it open very gently and closed it behind [her]38-mary , and [she]38-mary stood in [the corridor]583-the corridor and could hear the crying quite plainly , though it was not loud . It was on the other side of the wall at [her]38-mary left and a few yards farther on there was a door . [She]38-mary could see a glimmer of light coming from beneath it . [The Someone]873-the someone was crying in [that room]874-that room , and it was quite [a young Someone]875-a young someone .

So [she]38-mary walked to the door and pushed it open , and there [she]38-mary was standing in [the room]201-the room !

It was [a big room with ancient , handsome furniture in [it]877-a big room with ancient , handsome furniture in it]877-a big room with ancient , handsome furniture in it . There was a low fire glowing faintly on the hearth and a night light burning by the side of a carved four - posted bed hung with brocade , and on the bed was lying [a boy]155-a boy , crying fretfully .

[Mary]38-mary wondered if [she]38-mary was in a real place or if [she]38-mary had fallen asleep again and was dreaming without knowing it .

[The boy]792-the boy had a sharp , delicate face the color of ivory and [he]792-the boy seemed to have eyes too big for it . [He]792-the boy had also a lot of hair which tumbled over [his]792-the boy forehead in heavy locks and made [his]792-the boy thin face seem smaller . [He]792-the boy looked like [a boy who had been ill]880-a boy who had been ill , but [he]792-the boy was crying more as if [he]792-the boy were tired and cross than as if [he]792-the boy were in pain .

[Mary]38-mary stood near the door with [her]38-mary candle in [her]38-mary hand , holding [her]38-mary breath . Then [she]38-mary crept across [the room]201-the room , and , as [she]38-mary drew nearer , the light attracted [the boy]792-the boy 's attention and [he]792-the boy turned [his]792-the boy head on [his]792-the boy pillow and stared at [her]38-mary , [his]792-the boy gray eyes opening so wide that they seemed immense .

" Who are [you]38-mary ? "[792-the boy] [he]792-the boy said at last in a half - frightened whisper . " Are [you]38-mary [a ghost]2446-a ghost ? "[792-the boy]

" No , [I]38-mary am not , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary answered , [her]38-mary own whisper sounding half frightened . " Are [you]38-mary one ? "[38-mary]

[He]792-the boy stared and stared and stared . [Mary]38-mary could not help noticing what strange eyes [he]792-the boy had . They were agate gray and they looked too big for [his]792-the boy face because they had black lashes all round them .

" [[Your]792-the boy father]1829-your father ! "[38-mary] gasped [Mary]38-mary . " [No one]145-no one ever told [me]38-mary [he]41-mr. craven had [a boy]155-a boy ! Why did n't [they]2452-they ? "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary came close to the bed and [he]792-the boy put out [his]792-the boy hand and touched [her]38-mary .

" [You]38-mary are real , are n't [you]38-mary ? "[792-the boy] [he]792-the boy said . " [I]792-the boy have such real dreams very often . [You]38-mary might be one of them . "[792-the boy]

" Rub that and see how thick and warm it is , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " [I]38-mary will pinch [you]792-the boy a little if [you]792-the boy like , to show [you]792-the boy how real [I]38-mary am . For a minute [I]38-mary thought [you]792-the boy might be a dream too . "[38-mary]

" Where did [you]38-mary come from ? "[792-the boy] [he]792-the boy asked .

" From [[my]38-mary own room]2453-my own room . The wind wuthered so [I]38-mary could n't go to sleep and [I]38-mary heard [some one]151-some one crying and wanted to find out who it was . What were [you]38-mary crying for ? "[38-mary]

" Because [I]38-mary could n't go to sleep either and [my]38-mary head ached . Tell [me]38-mary [your]38-mary name again . "[38-mary]

" [Mary Lennox]38-mary . Did [no one]145-no one ever tell [you]38-mary [I]38-mary had come to live [here]1771-here ? "[38-mary]

[He]792-the boy was still fingering the fold of [her]885-her wrapper , but [he]792-the boy began to look a little more as if [he]792-the boy believed in [her]885-her reality .

" No , "[792-the boy] [he]792-the boy answered . " [They]2457-they dare n't . "[792-the boy]

" Why ? "[38-mary] asked [Mary]38-mary .

" Because [I]792-the boy should have been afraid [you]792-the boy would see [me]792-the boy . [I]792-the boy wo n't let [people]167-people see [me]792-the boy and talk [me]792-the boy over . "[792-the boy]

" Why ? "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary asked again , feeling more mystified every moment .

" Because [I]792-the boy am like this always , ill and having to lie down . [[My]792-the boy father]1923-my father wo n't let [people]167-people talk [me]792-the boy over either . " Why ? "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary could not help asking again .

[Mary]38-mary put down [her]38-mary candle on the table near the bed and sat down on the cushioned stool . [She]38-mary did not want to go away at all . " What do [you]792-the boy want [me]38-mary to tell [you]792-the boy ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said .

[He]792-the boy made [her]38-mary tell [him]792-the boy a great deal about [India]2-india and about [her]38-mary voyage across [the ocean]895-the ocean . Though [[his]792-the boy father]900-his father rarely saw [him]792-the boy when [he]792-the boy was awake , [he]792-the boy was given all sorts of wonderful things to amuse [himself]792-the boy with . [He]792-the boy never seemed to have been amused , however . [He]792-the boy could have anything [he]792-the boy asked for and was never made to do anything [he]792-the boy did not like to do . " [Everyone]174-everyone is obliged to do what pleases [me]792-the boy , "[792-the boy] [he]792-the boy said indifferently . " It makes [me]792-the boy ill to be angry . [No one]145-no one believes [I]792-the boy shall live to grow up . "[792-the boy]

[He]792-the boy said it as if [he]792-the boy was so accustomed to the idea that it had ceased to matter to [him]792-the boy at all . [He]792-the boy seemed to like the sound of [Mary]38-mary 's voice . As [she]38-mary went on talking [he]792-the boy listened in a drowsy , interested way . " How old are [you]38-mary ? "[792-the boy] [he]792-the boy asked .

" [I]38-mary am ten , "[38-mary] answered [Mary]38-mary , forgetting [herself]38-mary for the moment , " and so are [you]792-the boy . "[38-mary]

" Because when [you]38-mary were born the garden door was locked and the key was buried . And it has been locked for ten years . "[792-the boy]

[Mary]38-mary had not known that [she]38-mary [herself]38-mary had been spoiled , but [she]38-mary could see quite plainly that [this mysterious boy]904-this mysterious boy had been . "[38-mary]

[Mary]38-mary began to recover [her]38-mary breath and feel safer because the idea of keeping the secret seemed to please [him]910-he . " [I]38-mary 'll tell [you]910-he what [I]38-mary think it would be like , if [we]2522-we could go into it , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " It has been shut up so long things have grown into a tangle perhaps . "[38-mary]

[He]910-he lay quite still and listened while [she]38-mary went on talking about the roses which might have clambered from tree to tree and hung down about the many birds which might have built [their]913-their nests there because it was so safe . And then [she]38-mary told [him]910-he about the robin and [Ben Weatherstaff]57-ben weatherstaff , and there was so much to tell about the robin and it was so easy and safe to talk about it that [she]38-mary ceased to be afraid . The robin pleased [him]910-he so much that [he]910-he smiled until [he]910-he looked almost beautiful , and at first [Mary]38-mary had thought that [he]910-he was even plainer than [herself]38-mary , with [his]910-he big eyes and heavy locks of hair .

" [I]910-he did not know birds could be like that , "[910-he] [he]910-he said . " But if [you]38-mary stay in [a room]386-a room [you]38-mary never see things . What a lot of things [you]38-mary know . [I]910-he feel as if [you]38-mary had been inside [that garden]2028-that garden . "[910-he]

[Mary]38-mary had not noticed it before , but [she]38-mary looked up and saw it . It was a curtain of soft silk hanging over what seemed to be some picture .

" There is a cord hanging from it , "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin . " Go and pull it . "[81-colin]

[Mary]38-mary got up , much mystified , and found the cord . When [she]38-mary pulled it the silk curtain ran back on rings and when it ran back it uncovered a picture . [She]914-a girl with a laughing face had bright hair tied up with a blue ribbon and [her]914-a girl with a laughing face gay , lovely eyes were exactly like [Colin]81-colin 's unhappy ones , agate gray and looking twice as big as they really were because of the black lashes all round them .

" [Martha]50-martha knew about [you]38-mary all the time ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said .

" Yes ; [she]50-martha often attends to [me]38-mary . [The nurse]2532-the nurse likes to get away from [me]38-mary and then [Martha]50-martha comes . "[38-mary]

" [I]38-mary have been [here]1771-here a long time , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " Shall [I]38-mary go away now ? [Your]916-he eyes look sleepy . "[38-mary]

" [I]916-he wish [I]916-he could go to sleep before [you]38-mary leave [me]916-he , "[916-he] [he]916-he said rather shyly .

" Shut [your]916-he eyes , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary , drawing [her]38-mary footstool closer , " and [I]38-mary will do what [[my]38-mary Ayah]1757-my ayah used to do in [India]2-india . [I]38-mary will pat [your]916-he hand and stroke it and sing something quite low . "[38-mary]

" [I]916-he should like that perhaps , "[916-he] [he]916-he said drowsily .

Somehow [she]38-mary was sorry for [him]916-he and did not want [him]916-he to lie awake , so [she]38-mary leaned against the bed and began to stroke and pat [his]916-he hand and sing a very low little chanting song in Hindustani .

" That is nice , "[916-he] [he]916-he said more drowsily still , and [she]38-mary went on chanting and stroking , but when [she]38-mary looked at [him]916-he again [his]916-he black lashes were lying close against [his]916-he cheeks , for [his]916-he eyes were shut and [he]916-he was fast asleep . So [she]38-mary got up softly , took [her]38-mary candle and crept away without making a sound .

[CHAPTER XIV

A YOUNG RAJAH]83-chapter xiv a young rajah

[The moor]1835-the moor was hidden in mist when the morning came , and the rain had not stopped pouring down . There could be no going out of doors . [Martha]50-martha was so busy that [Mary]38-mary had no opportunity of talking to [her]50-martha , but in the afternoon [she]38-mary asked [her]50-martha to come and sit with [her]50-martha in [the nursery]173-the nursery . [She]38-mary came bringing the stocking [she]38-mary was always knitting when [she]38-mary was doing nothing else .

" What 's the matter with [thee]50-martha ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary asked as soon as [they]919-they sat down . " [Tha]2540-tha ' looks as if tha'd somethin' to say . "[38-mary]

" [I]38-mary have . [I]38-mary have found out what the crying was , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

[Martha]50-martha let [her]50-martha knitting drop on [her]50-martha knee and gazed at [her]50-martha with startled eyes .

" Tha ' has n't ! "[50-martha] [she]50-martha exclaimed . " Never ! "[50-martha]

" [I]38-mary heard it in the night , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary went on . " And [I]38-mary got up and went to see where it came from . It was [Colin]81-colin . [I]38-mary found [him]81-colin . "[38-mary]

[Martha]50-martha 's face became red with fright .

" Eh ! [Miss Mary]38-mary ! "[50-martha] [she]50-martha said half crying . " [Tha]2540-tha ' should n't have done it [tha]2540-tha ' should n't ! [Tha'll]2540-tha get [me]50-martha in trouble . [I]50-martha never told [thee]38-mary nothin' about [him]81-colin but tha'll get [me]50-martha in trouble . [I]50-martha shall lose [my]50-martha place and what 'll [mother]224-mother do ! "[50-martha]

" [You]50-martha wo n't lose [your]50-martha place , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " [He]81-colin was glad [I]38-mary came . [We]2542-us talked and talked and [he]81-colin said [he]81-colin was glad [I]38-mary came . "[38-mary]

" Was [he]81-colin ? "[50-martha] cried [Martha]50-martha . " Art tha ' sure ? [Tha]81-colin ' does n't know what [he]81-colin 's like when anything vexes [him]81-colin . [He]81-colin 's [a big lad]2543-a big lad to cry like [a baby]2544-a baby , but when [he]81-colin 's in a passion [he]81-colin 'll fair scream just to frighten [us]2542-us . [He]81-colin knows [us]2542-us dare n't call [our]2542-us souls [our]2542-us own . "[50-martha]

" [He]81-colin was n't vexed , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " [I]38-mary asked [him]81-colin if [I]38-mary should go away and [he]81-colin made [me]38-mary stay . [He]81-colin asked [me]38-mary questions and [I]38-mary sat on a big footstool and talked to [him]81-colin about [India]2-india and about [the robin and gardens]2545-the robin and gardens . [He]81-colin would n't let [me]38-mary go . [He]81-colin let [me]38-mary see [[his]81-colin mother]2546-his mother 's picture . Before [I]38-mary left [him]81-colin [I]38-mary sang [him]81-colin to sleep . "[38-mary]

[Martha]50-martha fairly gasped with amazement .

" [I]50-martha can scarcely believe [thee]50-martha ! "[50-martha] [she]50-martha protested . " It 's as if tha'd walked straight into [a lion 's den]2547-a lion 's den . If [he]81-colin 'd been like [he]81-colin is most times [he]81-colin 'd have throwed [himself]81-colin into one of [his]81-colin tantrums and roused [th ' house]2548-th ' house . [He]81-colin wo n't let [strangers]2549-strangers look at [him]81-colin . "[50-martha]

" [He]81-colin let [me]38-mary look at [him]81-colin . [I]38-mary looked at [him]81-colin all the time and [he]81-colin looked at [me]38-mary . [We]2550-we stared ! "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

" [I]50-martha do n't know what to do ! "[50-martha] cried [agitated Martha]50-martha . " If [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock finds out , [she]45-mrs. medlock 'll think [I]50-martha broke orders and told [thee]2551-thee and [I]50-martha shall be packed back to [mother]224-mother . "[50-martha]

" [He]81-colin is not going to tell [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock anything about it yet . It 's to be a sort of secret just at first , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary firmly . " And [he]81-colin says [everybody]185-everybody is obliged to do as [he]81-colin pleases . "[38-mary]

" Aye , that 's true enough [th ' bad lad]2554-th ' bad lad ! "[50-martha] sighed [Martha]50-martha , wiping [her]50-martha forehead with [her]50-martha apron .

" [He]81-colin says [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock must . And [he]81-colin wants [me]38-mary to come and talk to [him]81-colin every day . And [you]50-martha are to tell [me]38-mary when [he]81-colin wants [me]38-mary . "[38-mary]

" [Me]50-martha ! "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha ; " [I]50-martha shall lose [my]50-martha place [I]50-martha shall for sure ! "[50-martha]

" [You]50-martha ca n't if [you]50-martha are doing what [he]81-colin wants [you]50-martha to do and [everybody]185-everybody is ordered to obey [him]81-colin , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary argued .

" Does tha ' mean to say , "[50-martha] cried [Martha]50-martha with wide open eyes , " that [he]81-colin was nice to [thee]50-martha ! "[50-martha]

" [I]38-mary think [he]81-colin almost liked [me]38-mary , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary answered .

" Then tha ' must have bewitched [him]81-colin ! "[50-martha] decided [Martha]50-martha , drawing a long breath .

" Do [you]38-mary mean Magic ? "[38-mary] inquired [Mary]38-mary . " [I]38-mary 've heard about Magic in [India]2-india , but [I]38-mary ca n't make it . [I]38-mary just went into [[his]81-colin room]2556-his room and [I]38-mary was so surprised to see [him]81-colin [I]38-mary stood and stared . And then [he]81-colin turned round and stared at [me]38-mary . And [he]81-colin thought [I]38-mary was a ghost or a dream and [I]38-mary thought perhaps [he]81-colin was . And it was so queer being there alone together in the middle of the night and not knowing about [each other]241-each other . And [we]241-each other began to ask [each other]241-each other questions . And when [I]38-mary asked [him]81-colin if [I]38-mary must go away [he]81-colin said [I]38-mary must not . "[38-mary]

" [Th ' world]2220-th ' world 's comin ' to a end ! "[50-martha] gasped [Martha]50-martha .

" What is the matter with [him]81-colin ? "[38-mary] asked [Mary]38-mary .

" [Nobody]175-nobody knows for sure and certain , "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha . " [Mr. Craven]41-mr. craven went off [his]81-colin head like when [he]81-colin was born . [Th ' doctors]2041-th ' doctors thought [he]81-colin 'd have to be put in a ' sylum . It was because [Mrs. Craven]59-mrs. craven died like [I]50-martha told [you]2562-you . [He]81-colin would n't set eyes on [th ' baby]2563-th ' baby . [He]81-colin just raved and said it 'd be another hunchback like [him]81-colin and it 'd better die . "[50-martha]

" Is [Colin]81-colin [a hunchback]1798-a hunchback ? "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary asked . " [He]81-colin did n't look like [one]406-one . "[38-mary]

" [He]81-colin is n't yet , "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha . " But [he]81-colin began all wrong . [Mother]224-mother said that there was enough trouble and raging in [th ' house]2548-th ' house to set [any child]2412-any child wrong . [They]2041-th ' doctors was afraid [his]81-colin back was weak an ' [they]2041-th ' doctors 've always been takin ' care of it keepin ' [him]81-colin lyin ' down and not lettin ' [him]81-colin walk . Once [they]2041-th ' doctors made [him]81-colin wear a brace but [he]81-colin fretted so [he]81-colin was downright ill . Then [a big doctor]2569-a big doctor came to see [him]81-colin an ' made [them]2041-th ' doctors take it off . [He]81-colin talked to [th ' other doctor]2570-th ' other doctor quite rough in a polite way . [He]81-colin said there 'd been too much medicine and too much lettin ' [him]81-colin have [his]81-colin own way . "[50-martha]

" [I]38-mary think [he]81-colin 's [a very spoiled boy]2571-a very spoiled boy , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

" [He]81-colin 's [th]2570-th ' other doctor ' worst young nowt as ever was ! "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha . " [I]50-martha wo n't say as [he]81-colin has n't been ill a good bit . [He]81-colin 's had coughs an ' colds that 's nearly killed [him]81-colin two or three times . Once [he]81-colin had rheumatic fever an ' once [he]81-colin had typhoid . Eh ! [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock did get a fright then . [He]81-colin 'd been out of [his]81-colin head an ' [she]45-mrs. medlock was talkin ' to [th ' nurse]2572-th ' nurse , thinkin ' [he]81-colin did n't know nothin' , an ' [she]45-mrs. medlock said , ' [He]81-colin 'll die this time sure enough , an ' best thing for [him]81-colin an ' for [everybody]185-everybody . ' An ' [she]45-mrs. medlock looked at [him]81-colin an ' there [he]81-colin was with [his]81-colin big eyes open , starin ' at [her]45-mrs. medlock as sensible as [she]45-mrs. medlock was [herself]45-mrs. medlock . [She]45-mrs. medlock did n't know wha'd happen but [he]81-colin just stared at [her]45-mrs. medlock an ' says , ' [You]45-mrs. medlock give [me]50-martha some water an ' stop talkin ' . ' "[50-martha]

" Do [you]38-mary think [he]81-colin will die ? "[38-mary] asked [Mary]38-mary .

" [Mother]53-mother says there 's no reason why [any child]2412-any child should live that gets no fresh air an ' does n't do nothin' but lie on [his]81-colin back an ' read picture - books an ' take medicine . [He]81-colin 's weak and hates [th]2575-th ' trouble o ' bein ' taken out o ' [doors]2576-doors , an ' [he]81-colin gets cold so easy [he]81-colin says it makes [him]81-colin ill . "[50-martha]

[Mary]38-mary sat and looked at the fire . " [I]38-mary wonder , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said slowly , " if it would not do [him]81-colin good to go out into [a garden]245-a garden and watch things growing . It did [me]38-mary good . "[38-mary]

" One of th ' worst fits [he]81-colin ever had , "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha , " was one time [they]2578-they took [him]81-colin out where the roses is by the fountain . [He]81-colin 'd been readin ' in a paper about [people]167-people gettin ' somethin' [he]81-colin called ' rose cold ' an ' [he]81-colin began to sneeze an ' said [he]81-colin 'd got it an ' then [a new gardener]2580-a new gardener as did n't know th ' rules passed by an ' looked at [him]81-colin curious . [He]81-colin threw [himself]81-colin into a passion an ' [he]81-colin said [he]81-colin 'd looked at [him]81-colin because [he]81-colin was going to be [a hunchback]1798-a hunchback . [He]81-colin cried [himself]81-colin into a fever an ' was ill all night . "[50-martha]

" If [he]81-colin ever gets angry at [me]38-mary , [I]38-mary 'll never go and see [him]81-colin again , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

" [He]81-colin 'll have [thee]2582-thee if [he]81-colin wants [thee]2582-thee , "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha . " [Tha]81-colin ' may as well know that at th ' start . "[50-martha]

Very soon afterward a bell rang and [she]50-martha rolled up [her]50-martha knitting .

" [I]50-martha dare say [th ' nurse]2572-th ' nurse wants [me]50-martha to stay with [him]81-colin a bit , "[50-martha] [she]50-martha said . " [I]50-martha hope [he]81-colin 's in a good temper . "[50-martha]

[She]50-martha was out of [the room]201-the room about ten minutes and then [she]50-martha came back with a puzzled expression .

" Well , [tha]81-colin ' has bewitched [him]81-colin , "[50-martha] [she]50-martha said . " [He]81-colin 's up on [his]81-colin sofa with [his]81-colin picture - books . [He]81-colin 's told [the nurse]2532-the nurse to stay away until six o'clock . [I]50-martha 'm to wait in [the next room]2585-the next room . Th ' minute [she]2532-the nurse was gone [he]81-colin called [me]50-martha to [him]81-colin an ' says , ' [I]50-martha want [Mary Lennox]38-mary to come and talk to [me]50-martha , and remember [you]38-mary 're not to tell [any one]189-any one . ' [You]38-mary 'd better go as quick as [you]38-mary can . "[50-martha]

[Mary]38-mary was quite willing to go quickly . [She]38-mary did not want to see [Colin]81-colin as much as [she]38-mary wanted to see [Dickon]54-dickon ; but [she]38-mary wanted to see [him]81-colin very much .

There was a bright fire on the hearth when [she]38-mary entered [[his]81-colin room]2556-his room , and in the daylight [she]38-mary saw it was [a very beautiful room]922-a very beautiful room indeed . There were rich colors in the rugs and hangings and pictures and books on the walls which made [it]2556-his room look glowing and comfortable even in spite of the gray sky and falling rain . [Colin]81-colin looked rather like a picture [himself]81-colin . [He]81-colin was wrapped in a velvet dressing - gown and sat against a big brocaded cushion . [He]81-colin had a red spot on each cheek .

" Come in , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " [I]81-colin 've been thinking about [you]38-mary all morning . "[81-colin]

" [I]38-mary 've been thinking about [you]81-colin , too , "[38-mary] answered [Mary]38-mary . " [You]81-colin do n't know how frightened [Martha]50-martha is . [She]50-martha says [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock will think [she]50-martha told [me]38-mary about [you]81-colin and then [she]50-martha will be sent away . "[38-mary]

[He]81-colin frowned .

" Go and tell [her]50-martha to come here , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " [She]923-she is in [the next room]2585-the next room . "[81-colin]

[Mary]38-mary went and brought [her]923-she back . [Poor Martha]50-martha was shaking in [her]50-martha shoes . [Colin]81-colin was still frowning .

" Have [you]50-martha to do what [I]81-colin please or have [you]50-martha not ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin demanded .

" [I]50-martha have to do what [you]81-colin please , [sir]2395-sir , "[50-martha] [Martha]50-martha faltered , turning quite red .

" Has [Medlock]45-mrs. medlock to do what [I]50-martha please ? "[50-martha]

" [Everybody]185-everybody has , [sir]2395-sir , "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha .

" Well , then , if [I]50-martha order [you]81-colin to bring [Miss Mary]38-mary to [me]50-martha , how can [Medlock]45-mrs. medlock send [you]81-colin away if [she]38-mary finds it out ? "[50-martha]

" Please do n't let [her]38-mary , [sir]2395-sir , "[50-martha] pleaded [Martha]50-martha .

" [I]41-mr. craven 'll send [her]38-mary away if [she]38-mary dares to say a word about such a thing , "[41-mr. craven] said [Master Craven]41-mr. craven grandly . " [She]38-mary would n't like that , [I]41-mr. craven can tell [you]81-colin . "[41-mr. craven]

" Thank [you]2395-sir , [sir]2395-sir , "[50-martha] bobbing a curtsy , " [I]50-martha want to do [my]50-martha duty , [sir]2395-sir . "[50-martha]

" What [I]81-colin want is [your]38-mary duty "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin more grandly still . " [I]81-colin 'll take care of [you]50-martha . Now go away . "[81-colin]

When the door closed behind [Martha]50-martha , [Colin]81-colin found [Mistress Mary]38-mary gazing at [him]81-colin as if [he]81-colin had set [her]38-mary wondering .

" Why do [you]38-mary look at [me]81-colin like that ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin asked [her]38-mary . " What are [you]38-mary thinking about ? "[81-colin]

" [I]81-colin am thinking about two things . "[81-colin]

" What are [they]2594-they ? Sit down and tell [me]81-colin . "[81-colin]

" This is the first one , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary , seating [herself]38-mary on the big stool . " Once in [India]2-india [I]38-mary saw [a boy who was [a Rajah]2596-a rajah]2595-a boy who was a rajah . [He]2595-a boy who was a rajah had rubies and emeralds and diamonds stuck all over [him]2595-a boy who was a rajah . [He]2595-a boy who was a rajah spoke to [[his]2595-a boy who was a rajah people]2597-his people just as [you]38-mary spoke to [Martha]50-martha . [Everybody]185-everybody had to do everything [he]2595-a boy who was a rajah told [them]185-everybody in a minute . [I]38-mary think [they]185-everybody would have been killed if [they]185-everybody had n't . "[38-mary]

" [I]924-me shall make [you]38-mary tell [me]924-me about [Rajahs]85-rajahs presently , "[924-me] [he]924-me said , " but first tell [me]924-me what the second thing was . "[924-me]

" [I]38-mary was thinking , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary , " how different [you]924-me are from [Dickon]54-dickon . "[38-mary]

" Who is [Dickon]54-dickon ? "[924-me] [he]924-me said . " What a queer name ! "[924-me]

[She]38-mary might as well tell [him]924-me , [she]38-mary thought [she]38-mary could talk about [Dickon]54-dickon without mentioning [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden . [She]38-mary had liked to hear [Martha]50-martha talk about [him]54-dickon . Besides , [she]38-mary longed to talk about [him]54-dickon . It would seem to bring [him]54-dickon nearer .

" [He]54-dickon is [[Martha]50-martha 's brother]2599-martha 's brother . [He]54-dickon is twelve years old , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary explained . " [He]54-dickon is not like [any one else in [the world]234-the world]2600-any one else in the world . [He]54-dickon can charm foxes and squirrels and birds just as [the natives in [India]2-india]2602-the natives in india charm snakes . [He]54-dickon plays a very soft tune on a pipe and [they]2602-the natives in india come and listen . "[38-mary]

There were some big books on a table at [his]54-dickon side and [he]54-dickon dragged one suddenly toward [him]54-dickon . " There is a picture of [a snake - charmer]2603-a snake - charmer in this , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon exclaimed . " Come and look at it . "[54-dickon]

The book was a beautiful one with superb colored illustrations and [he]54-dickon turned to one of [them]926-them .

" Can [he]54-dickon do that ? "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon asked eagerly .

" [He]54-dickon played on [his]54-dickon pipe and [they]2602-the natives in india listened , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary explained . " But [he]54-dickon does n't call it Magic . [He]54-dickon says it 's because [he]54-dickon lives on [the moor]1835-the moor so much and [he]54-dickon knows [their]2602-the natives in india ways . [He]54-dickon says [he]54-dickon feels sometimes as if [he]54-dickon was a bird or a rabbit [himself]54-dickon , [he]54-dickon likes [them]2602-the natives in india so . [I]38-mary think [he]54-dickon asked the robin questions . It seemed as if [they]2602-the natives in india talked to [each other]241-each other in soft chirps . "[38-mary]

[Colin]81-colin lay back on [his]81-colin cushion and [his]81-colin eyes grew larger and larger and the spots on [his]81-colin cheeks burned .

" Tell [me]81-colin some more about [him]54-dickon , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said .

" [He]54-dickon knows all about eggs and nests , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary went on . " And [he]54-dickon knows where foxes and badgers and otters live . [He]54-dickon keeps [them]2602-the natives in india secret so that [other boys]2606-other boys wo n't find [their]2602-the natives in india holes and frighten [them]2602-the natives in india . [He]54-dickon knows about everything that grows or lives on [the moor]1835-the moor . "[38-mary]

" Does [he]54-dickon like [the moor]1835-the moor ? "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin . " How can [he]54-dickon when it 's such [a great , bare , dreary place]2609-a great , bare , dreary place ? "[81-colin]

" [It]2609-a great , bare , dreary place 's [the most beautiful place]2610-the most beautiful place , "[38-mary] protested [Mary]38-mary . " Thousands of lovely things grow on [it]2609-a great , bare , dreary place and there are thousands of [little creatures all busy building nests and making holes and burrows and chippering or singing or squeaking to each other]2611-little creatures all busy building nests and making holes and burrows and chippering or singing or squeaking to each other . [They]2602-the natives in india are so busy and having such fun under [the earth]490-the earth or in the trees or heather . It 's [[their]2602-the natives in india world]2613-their world . "[38-mary]

" How do [you]38-mary know all that ? "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin , turning on [his]81-colin elbow to look at [her]38-mary .

" [I]38-mary have never been [there]2007-there once , really , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary suddenly remembering . " [I]38-mary only drove over it in the dark . [I]38-mary thought it was hideous . [Martha]50-martha told [me]38-mary about it first and then [Dickon]54-dickon . When [Dickon]54-dickon talks about it [you]2615-you feel as if [you]2615-you saw things and heard them and as if [you]2615-you were standing in the heather with the sun shining and the gorse smelling like honey and all full of bees and butterflies . "[38-mary]

" [You]38-mary never see anything if [you]38-mary are ill , "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin restlessly . [He]81-colin looked like [a person listening to a new sound in the distance]927-a person listening to a new sound in the distance and wondering what it was .

" [You]81-colin ca n't if [you]81-colin stay in [a room]386-a room , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

" [I]81-colin could n't go on [the moor]1835-the moor , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said in a resentful tone .

[Mary]38-mary was silent for a minute and then [she]38-mary said something bold .

" [You]81-colin might sometime . "[38-mary]

[He]81-colin moved as if [he]81-colin were startled .

" Go on [the moor]1835-the moor ! How could [I]38-mary ? [I]38-mary am going to die . "[38-mary] " How do [you]81-colin know ? "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary unsympathetically . [She]38-mary did n't like the way [he]81-colin had of talking about dying . [She]38-mary did not feel very sympathetic . [She]38-mary felt rather as if [he]81-colin almost boasted about it .

" Oh , [I]81-colin 've heard it ever since [I]81-colin remember , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin answered crossly . " [They]2619-they are always whispering about it and thinking [I]81-colin do n't notice . [They]2619-they wish [I]81-colin would , too . "[81-colin]

[Mistress Mary]38-mary felt quite contrary . [She]38-mary pinched [her]38-mary lips together .

" If [they]2619-they wished [I]38-mary would , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said , " [I]38-mary would n't . Who wishes [you]81-colin would ? "[38-mary]

" [The servants]162-the servants and of course [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven because [he]86-dr. craven would get Misselthwaite and be rich instead of [poor]2621-poor . [He]86-dr. craven dare n't say so , but [he]86-dr. craven always looks cheerful when [I]38-mary am worse . When [I]38-mary had typhoid fever [his]86-dr. craven face got quite fat . [I]38-mary think [[my]38-mary father]1923-my father wishes it , too . "[38-mary]

" [I]38-mary do n't believe [he]86-dr. craven does , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary quite obstinately .

That made [Colin]81-colin turn and look at [her]38-mary again .

" Do n't [you]38-mary ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said .

And then [he]81-colin lay back on [his]81-colin cushion and was still , as if [he]81-colin were thinking . And there was quite a long silence . Perhaps [they]928-they were both of [them]928-they thinking strange things [children]1816-children do not usually think . " [I]38-mary like [the grand doctor from [London]4-london]2623-the grand doctor from london , because [he]2623-the grand doctor from london made [them]2623-the grand doctor from london take the iron thing off , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary at last " Did [he]2623-the grand doctor from london say [you]81-colin were going to die ? "[38-mary]

" No . "[928-they] .

" What did [he]2623-the grand doctor from london say ? "[38-mary]

" [He]2623-the grand doctor from london did n't whisper , "[81-colin] [Colin]81-colin answered . " Perhaps [he]2623-the grand doctor from london knew [I]81-colin hated whispering . [I]81-colin heard [him]2623-the grand doctor from london say one thing quite aloud . [He]2623-the grand doctor from london said , ' [The lad]2624-the lad might live if [he]2623-the grand doctor from london would make up [his]2623-the grand doctor from london mind to it . Put [him]2623-the grand doctor from london in the humor . ' It sounded as if [he]2623-the grand doctor from london was in a temper . "[81-colin]

" [I]38-mary 'll tell [you]81-colin who would put [you]81-colin in the humor , perhaps , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary reflecting . [She]38-mary felt as if [she]38-mary would like this thing to be settled one way or the other . " [I]38-mary believe [Dickon]54-dickon would . [He]54-dickon 's always talking about live things . [He]54-dickon never talks about dead things or things that are ill . [He]54-dickon 's always looking up in the sky to watch birds flying or looking down at the earth to see something growing . [He]54-dickon has such round blue eyes and they are so wide open with looking about . And [he]54-dickon laughs such a big laugh with [his]54-dickon wide mouth and [his]54-dickon cheeks are as red as red as cherries . "[38-mary] [She]38-mary pulled [her]38-mary stool nearer to the sofa and [her]38-mary expression quite changed at the remembrance of the wide curving mouth and wide open eyes .

" See here , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " Do n't let [us]2625-us talk about dying ; [I]38-mary do n't like it . Let [us]2625-us talk about living . Let [us]2625-us talk and talk about [Dickon]54-dickon . And then [we]2625-us will look at [your]54-dickon pictures . "[38-mary]

It was the best thing [she]38-mary could have said . To talk about [Dickon]54-dickon meant to talk about [the moor]1835-the moor and about [the cottage]646-the cottage and [the fourteen people who lived in [it]646-the cottage on sixteen shillings a week]932-the fourteen people who lived in it on sixteen shillings a week and [the children who got fat on the moor]933-the children who got fat on the moor grass like the wild ponies . And about [[Dickon]54-dickon 's mother]934-dickon 's mother and the skipping - rope and [the moor]1835-the moor with the sun on it and about pale green points sticking up out of the black sod . And it was all so alive that [Mary]38-mary talked more than [she]38-mary had ever talked before and [Colin]81-colin both talked and listened as [he]81-colin had never done either before . And [they]936-they both began to laugh over nothings as [children]1816-children will when [they]1816-children are happy together . And [they]936-they laughed so that in the end [they]936-they were making as much noise as if [they]936-they had been [two ordinary healthy natural ten - year - old creatures instead of [a hard , little , unloving girl]939-a hard , little , unloving girl and a sickly boy who believed that [he]81-colin was going to die]938-two ordinary healthy natural ten - year - old creatures instead of a hard , little , unloving girl and a sickly boy who believed that he was going to die .

[They]936-they enjoyed [themselves]936-they so much that [they]936-they forgot the pictures and [they]936-they forgot about the time . [They]936-they had been laughing quite loudly over [Ben Weatherstaff]57-ben weatherstaff and [[his]57-ben weatherstaff robin]940-his robin , and [Colin]81-colin was actually sitting up as if [he]81-colin had forgotten about [his]81-colin weak back , when [he]81-colin suddenly remembered something . " Do [you]45-mrs. medlock know there is one thing [we]936-they have never once thought of , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " [We]936-they are [cousins]2626-cousins . "[81-colin]

It seemed so queer that [they]936-they had talked so much and never remembered this simple thing that [they]936-they laughed more than ever , because [they]936-they had got into the humor to laugh at anything . And in the midst of the fun the door opened and in walked [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven and [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock .

[Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven started in actual alarm and [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock almost fell back because [he]86-dr. craven had accidentally bumped against [her]45-mrs. medlock .

" [Good Lord]87-good lord ! "[45-mrs. medlock] exclaimed poor [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock with [her]45-mrs. medlock eyes almost starting out of [her]45-mrs. medlock head . " Good Lord ! "[45-mrs. medlock]

" What is this ? "[86-dr. craven] said [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven , coming forward . " What does it mean ? "[86-dr. craven]

Then [Mary]38-mary was reminded of [the boy Rajah]941-the boy rajah again . [Colin]81-colin answered as if neither [the doctor]2517-the doctor 's alarm nor [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock 's terror were of the slightest consequence . [He]81-colin was as little disturbed or frightened as if an elderly cat and dog had walked into [the room]201-the room .

" This is [[my]81-colin cousin]2627-my cousin , [Mary Lennox]38-mary , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " [I]81-colin asked [her]38-mary to come and talk to [me]81-colin . [I]81-colin like [her]38-mary . [She]38-mary must come and talk to [me]81-colin whenever [I]81-colin send for [her]38-mary . "[81-colin]

[Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven turned reproachfully to [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock . " Oh , [sir]2395-sir "[45-mrs. medlock] [she]45-mrs. medlock panted . " [I]45-mrs. medlock do n't know how it 's happened . There 's not [a servant]2629-a servant on [the place]228-the place tha'd dare to talk [they]2629-a servant all have [their]2629-a servant orders . "[45-mrs. medlock]

" [Nobody]175-nobody told [her]38-mary anything , "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin . " [She]38-mary heard [me]81-colin crying and found [me]81-colin [herself]38-mary . [I]81-colin am glad [she]38-mary came . Do n't be silly , [Medlock]45-mrs. medlock . "[81-colin]

[Mary]38-mary saw that [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven did not look pleased , but it was quite plain that [he]86-dr. craven dare not oppose [[his]86-dr. craven patient]944-his patient . [He]86-dr. craven sat down by [Colin]81-colin and felt [his]81-colin pulse .

" [I]86-dr. craven am afraid there has been too much excitement . Excitement is not good for [you]81-colin , [[my]86-dr. craven boy]2632-my boy , "[86-dr. craven] [he]86-dr. craven said .

" [I]81-colin should be excited if [she]38-mary kept away , "[81-colin] answered [Colin]81-colin , [his]81-colin eyes beginning to look dangerously sparkling . " [I]81-colin am better . [She]38-mary makes [me]81-colin better . [The nurse]2532-the nurse must bring up [her]2532-the nurse tea with [mine]81-colin . [We]2634-we will have tea together . "[81-colin]

[Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock and [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven looked at each other in a troubled way , but there was evidently nothing to be done .

" [He]86-dr. craven does look rather better , [sir]2395-sir , "[45-mrs. medlock] ventured [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock . " But "[45-mrs. medlock] thinking the matter over " [he]86-dr. craven looked better this morning before [she]38-mary came into [the room]201-the room . "[45-mrs. medlock]

" [She]38-mary came into [the room]201-the room last night . [She]38-mary stayed with [me]81-colin a long time . [She]38-mary sang a Hindustani song to [me]81-colin and it made [me]81-colin go to sleep , "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin . " [I]81-colin was better when [I]81-colin wakened up . [I]81-colin wanted [my]81-colin breakfast . [I]81-colin want [my]81-colin tea now . Tell [nurse]2638-nurse , [Medlock]45-mrs. medlock . "[81-colin]

[Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven did not stay very long . [He]86-dr. craven talked to [the nurse]2532-the nurse for a few minutes when [she]2532-the nurse came into [the room]201-the room and said a few words of warning to [Colin]81-colin . [He]86-dr. craven must not talk too much ; [he]86-dr. craven must not forget that [he]86-dr. craven was ill ; [he]86-dr. craven must not forget that [he]86-dr. craven was very easily tired . [Mary]38-mary thought that there seemed to be a number of uncomfortable things [he]86-dr. craven was not to forget .

[Colin]81-colin looked fretful and kept [his]81-colin strange black - lashed eyes fixed on [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven 's face .

" [I]81-colin want to forget it , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said at last . " [She]948-the little girl sitting on the large stool makes [me]81-colin forget it . That is why [I]81-colin want [her]948-the little girl sitting on the large stool . "[81-colin]

[Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven did not look happy when [he]86-dr. craven left [the room]201-the room . [He]86-dr. craven gave a puzzled glance at [the little girl sitting on the large stool]948-the little girl sitting on the large stool . [She]948-the little girl sitting on the large stool had become [a stiff , silent child]949-a stiff , silent child again as soon as [he]86-dr. craven entered and [he]86-dr. craven could not see what the attraction was . [The boy]792-the boy actually did look brighter , however and [he]792-the boy sighed rather heavily as [he]792-the boy went down [the corridor]583-the corridor .

" [They]2639-they are always wanting [me]81-colin to eat things when [I]81-colin do n't want to , "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin , as [the nurse]2532-the nurse brought in the tea and put it on the table by the sofa . " Now , if [you]948-the little girl sitting on the large stool 'll eat [I]81-colin will . Those muffins look so nice and hot . Tell [me]81-colin about [Rajahs]85-rajahs . "[81-colin]

CHAPTER XV

[NEST BUILDING]14-nest building

After another week of rain the high arch of blue sky appeared again and the sun which poured down was quite hot . Though there had been no chance to see either [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden or [Dickon]54-dickon , [Mistress Mary]38-mary had enjoyed [herself]38-mary very much . The week had not seemed long . [She]38-mary had spent hours of every day with [Colin]81-colin in [[his]81-colin room]2556-his room , talking about Rajahs or [gardens]1837-gardens or [Dickon]54-dickon and [the cottage on [the moor]1835-the moor]956-the cottage on the moor . [They]958-they had looked at the splendid books and pictures and sometimes [Mary]38-mary had read things to [Colin]81-colin , and sometimes [he]81-colin had read a little to [her]38-mary . When [he]81-colin was amused and interested [she]38-mary thought [he]81-colin scarcely looked like [an invalid]896-an invalid at all , except that [his]81-colin face was so colorless and [he]81-colin was always on the sofa .

" [You]81-colin are [a sly young one]2640-a sly young one to listen and get out of [your]81-colin bed to go following things up like [you]81-colin did that night , "[45-mrs. medlock] [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock said once . " But there 's no saying it 's not been a sort of blessing to [the lot of [us]2642-us]2641-the lot of us . [He]81-colin 's not had a tantrum or a whining fit since [you]81-colin made [friends]1934-friends . [The nurse]2532-the nurse was just going to give up the case because [she]2532-the nurse was so sick of [him]81-colin , but [she]2532-the nurse says [she]2532-the nurse does n't mind staying now [you]81-colin 've gone on duty with [her]2532-the nurse , "[45-mrs. medlock] laughing a little .

In [her]45-mrs. medlock talks with [Colin]81-colin , [Mary]38-mary had tried to be very cautious about [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden . There were certain things [she]45-mrs. medlock wanted to find out from [him]81-colin , but [she]45-mrs. medlock felt that [she]45-mrs. medlock must find them out without asking [him]81-colin direct questions . In the first place , as [she]45-mrs. medlock began to like to be with [him]81-colin , [she]45-mrs. medlock wanted to discover whether [he]81-colin was the kind of boy [you]961-you could tell a secret to . [He]81-colin was not in the least like [Dickon]54-dickon , but [he]81-colin was evidently so pleased with the idea of [a garden]245-a garden [no one]145-no one knew anything about that [she]45-mrs. medlock thought perhaps [he]81-colin could be trusted . But [she]45-mrs. medlock had not known [him]81-colin long enough to be sure . The second thing [she]45-mrs. medlock wanted to find out was this : If [he]81-colin could be trusted if [he]81-colin really could would n't it be possible to take [him]81-colin to [the garden]146-the garden without having [any one]189-any one find it out ? [The grand doctor]966-the grand doctor had said that [he]81-colin must have fresh air and [Colin]81-colin had said that [he]81-colin would not mind fresh air in [a secret garden]2315-a secret garden . Perhaps if [he]81-colin had a great deal of fresh air and knew [Dickon]54-dickon and [the robin]495-the robin and saw things growing [he]81-colin might not think so much about dying . [Mary]38-mary had seen [herself]38-mary in the glass sometimes lately when [she]38-mary had realized that [she]38-mary looked quite [a different creature from [the child [she]38-mary had seen when [she]38-mary arrived from [India]2-india]970-the child she had seen when she arrived from india]969-a different creature from the child she had seen when she arrived from india . [This child]971-this child looked nicer . Even [Martha]50-martha had seen a change in [her]971-this child .

" Th ' air from [th ' moor]1874-th ' moor has done [thee]971-this child good already , "[50-martha] [she]50-martha had said . " [Tha'rt]88-tha'rt not nigh so yeller and tha'rt not nigh so scrawny . Even [tha]88-tha'rt ' hair does n't slamp down on [tha]88-tha'rt ' head so flat . It 's got some life in it so as it sticks out a bit . "[50-martha]

" It 's like [me]38-mary , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " [It]2646-it 's growing stronger and fatter . [I]38-mary 'm sure there 's more of it . "[38-mary]

" [It]2646-it looks it , for sure , "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha , ruffling it up a little round [her]50-martha face . " [Tha'rt]88-tha'rt not half so ugly when it 's that way an ' there 's a bit o ' red in [tha]88-tha'rt ' cheeks . "[50-martha]

If [gardens]1837-gardens and fresh air had been good for [her]38-mary perhaps [they]973-they would be good for [Colin]81-colin . But then , if [he]81-colin hated [people]167-people to look at [him]81-colin , perhaps [he]81-colin would not like to see [Dickon]54-dickon .

" Why does it make [you]81-colin angry when [you]81-colin are looked at ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary inquired one day .

" [I]81-colin always hated it , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin answered , " even when [I]81-colin was very little . Then when [they]167-people took [me]81-colin to [the seaside]2476-the seaside and [I]81-colin used to lie in [[my]81-colin carriage]2648-my carriage [everybody]185-everybody used to stare and [ladies]395-ladies would stop and talk to [[my]81-colin nurse]2651-my nurse and then [they]395-ladies would begin to whisper and [I]81-colin knew then [they]395-ladies were saying [I]81-colin should n't live to grow up . Then sometimes [the ladies]2652-the ladies would pat [my]81-colin cheeks and say ' [Poor child]2653-poor child ! ' Once when [a lady]616-a lady did that [I]81-colin screamed out loud and bit [her]616-a lady hand . [She]616-a lady was so frightened [she]616-a lady ran away . "[81-colin]

" [She]616-a lady thought [you]81-colin had gone mad like a dog , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary , not at all admiringly .

" [I]81-colin do n't care what [she]616-a lady thought , "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin , frowning .

" [I]38-mary wonder why [you]81-colin did n't scream and bite [me]38-mary when [I]38-mary came into [[your]81-colin room]2655-your room ? "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . Then [she]38-mary began to smile slowly .

" [I]81-colin thought [you]38-mary were a ghost or a dream , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " [You]38-mary ca n't bite a ghost or a dream , and if [you]38-mary scream [they]2656-they do n't care . "[81-colin]

" Would [you]81-colin hate it if if [a boy]155-a boy looked at [you]81-colin ? "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary asked uncertainly .

[He]81-colin lay back on [his]81-colin cushion and paused thoughtfully .

" There 's [one boy]2658-one boy , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said quite slowly , as if [he]81-colin were thinking over every word , " there 's [one boy]2658-one boy [I]81-colin believe [I]81-colin should n't mind . It 's [that boy who knows where the foxes live [Dickon]54-dickon]2660-that boy who knows where the foxes live dickon . "[81-colin]

" [I]38-mary 'm sure [you]81-colin would n't mind [him]2660-that boy who knows where the foxes live dickon , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

" The birds do n't and other animals , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said , still thinking it over , " perhaps that 's why [I]81-colin should n't . [He]2660-that boy who knows where the foxes live dickon 's a sort of [animal charmer]2661-animal charmer and [I]81-colin am [a boy animal]2662-a boy animal . "[81-colin]

Then [he]81-colin laughed and [she]38-mary laughed too ; in fact it ended in [their]975-their both laughing a great deal and finding the idea of [a boy]155-a boy animal hiding in [his]81-colin hole very funny indeed .

What [Mary]38-mary felt afterward was that [she]38-mary need not fear about [Dickon]54-dickon .

On that first morning when the sky was blue again [Mary]38-mary wakened very early . The sun was pouring in slanting rays through the blinds and there was something so joyous in the sight of it that [she]38-mary jumped out of bed and ran to the window . [She]38-mary drew up the blinds and opened the window itself and a great waft of fresh , scented air blew in upon [her]38-mary . The moor was blue and the whole world looked as if something Magic had happened to it . There were tender little fluting sounds here and there and everywhere , as if scores of birds were beginning to tune up for a concert . [Mary]38-mary put [her]38-mary hand out of the window and held it in the sun .

" It 's warm warm ! "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " It will make the green points push up and up and up , and it will make the bulbs and roots work and struggle with all their might under the earth . "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary kneeled down and leaned out of the window as far as [she]38-mary could , breathing big breaths and sniffing the air until [she]38-mary laughed because [she]38-mary remembered what [[Dickon]54-dickon 's mother]934-dickon 's mother had said about the end of [his]54-dickon nose quivering like a rabbit 's . " It must be very early , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " The little clouds are all pink and [I]38-mary 've never seen the sky look like this . [No one]145-no one is up . [I]38-mary do n't even hear [the stable boys]2664-the stable boys . "[38-mary]

A sudden thought made [her]38-mary scramble to [her]38-mary feet .

" [I]38-mary ca n't wait ! [I]38-mary am going to see [the garden]146-the garden ! "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary had learned to dress [herself]38-mary by this time and [she]38-mary put on [her]38-mary clothes in five minutes . [She]38-mary knew a small side door which [she]38-mary could unbolt [herself]38-mary and [she]38-mary flew [downstairs]440-downstairs in [her]38-mary stocking feet and put on [her]38-mary shoes in [the hall]979-the hall . [She]38-mary unchained and unbolted and unlocked and when the door was open [she]38-mary sprang across the step with one bound , and there [she]38-mary was standing on the grass , which seemed to have turned green , and with the sun pouring down on [her]38-mary and warm sweet wafts about [her]38-mary and the fluting and twittering and singing coming from every bush and tree . [She]38-mary clasped [her]38-mary hands for pure joy and looked up in the sky and it was so blue and pink and pearly and white and flooded with springtime light that [she]38-mary felt as if [she]38-mary must flute and sing aloud [herself]38-mary and knew that thrushes and robins and skylarks could not possibly help it . [She]38-mary ran around the shrubs and paths towards [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden .

" It is all different already , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " The grass is greener and things are sticking up everywhere and things are uncurling and green buds of leaves are showing . This afternoon [I]38-mary am sure [Dickon]54-dickon will come . "[38-mary]

The long warm rain had done strange things to the herbaceous beds which bordered the walk by the lower wall . There were things sprouting and pushing out from the roots of clumps of plants and there were actually here and there glimpses of royal purple and yellow unfurling among the stems of crocuses . Six months before [Mistress Mary]38-mary would not have seen how [the world]234-the world was waking up , but now [she]38-mary missed nothing .

When [she]38-mary had reached the place where the door hid itself under the ivy , [she]38-mary was startled by a curious loud sound . It was the caw caw of a crow and it came from the top of the wall , and when [she]38-mary looked up , there sat a big glossy - plumaged blue - black bird , looking down at [her]38-mary very wisely indeed . [She]38-mary had never seen a crow so close before and [he]982-he made [her]38-mary a little nervous , but the next moment [he]982-he spread [his]982-he wings and flapped away across [the garden]146-the garden . [She]38-mary hoped [he]982-he was not going to stay inside and [she]38-mary pushed the door open wondering if [he]982-he would . When [she]38-mary got fairly into [the garden]146-the garden [she]38-mary saw that [he]982-he probably did intend to stay because [he]982-he had alighted on a dwarf apple - tree and under the apple - tree was lying a little reddish animal with a Bushy tail , and both of [them]985-them were watching the stooping body and rust - red head of [Dickon]54-dickon , who was kneeling on the grass working hard .

[Mary]38-mary flew across the grass to [him]982-he .

" Oh , [Dickon]54-dickon ! [Dickon]54-dickon ! "[38-mary] [she]38-mary cried out . " How could [you]54-dickon get [here]1771-here so early ! How could [you]54-dickon ! The sun has only just got up ! "[38-mary]

[He]982-he got up [himself]982-he , laughing and glowing , and tousled ; [his]982-he eyes like a bit of the sky .

" Eh ! "[982-he] [he]982-he said . " [I]982-he was up long before [him]982-he . How could [I]982-he have stayed abed ! [Th ' world]2220-th ' world 's all fair begun again this mornin ' , it has . An ' it 's workin ' an ' hummin ' an ' scratchin ' an ' pipin ' an ' nest - buildin ' an ' breathin ' out scents , till [you]2668-you 've got to be out on it ' stead o ' lyin ' on [your]2668-you back . When th ' sun did jump up , [th ' moor]1874-th ' moor went mad for joy , an ' [I]982-he was in the midst of th ' heather , an ' [I]982-he run like mad [myself]982-he , shoutin ' an ' singin ' . An ' [I]982-he come straight here . [I]982-he could n't have stayed away . Why , [th ' garden]2035-th ' garden was lyin ' here waitin ' ! "[982-he]

[Mary]38-mary put [her]38-mary hands on [her]38-mary chest , panting , as if [she]38-mary had been running [herself]38-mary .

" Oh , [Dickon]54-dickon ! [Dickon]54-dickon ! "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " [I]38-mary 'm so happy [I]38-mary can scarcely breathe ! "[38-mary]

Seeing [him]986-he talking to [a stranger]987-a stranger , the little bushy - tailed animal rose from its place under the tree and came to [him]986-he , and [the rook , cawing once]988-the rook , cawing once , flew down from its branch and settled quietly on [his]986-he shoulder .

" This is [th ' little fox cub]2671-th ' little fox cub , "[986-he] [he]986-he said , rubbing the little reddish animal 's head . " It 's named [Captain]2672-captain . An ' this here 's Soot . [Soot]61-soot [he]986-he flew across [th ' moor]1874-th ' moor with [me]986-he an ' [Captain]2672-captain [he]986-he run same as if [th]2675-th ' hounds had been after [him]986-he . [They]2676-they both felt same as [I]986-he did . "[986-he]

[Neither of the creatures]989-neither of the creatures looked as if [he]986-he were the least afraid of [Mary]38-mary . When [Dickon]54-dickon began to walk about , [Soot]61-soot stayed on [his]54-dickon shoulder and [Captain]47-captain trotted quietly close to [his]54-dickon side .

" See here ! "[54-dickon] said [Dickon]54-dickon . " See how these has pushed up , an ' these an ' these ! An ' Eh ! Look at these here ! "[54-dickon]

[He]54-dickon threw [himself]54-dickon upon [his]54-dickon knees and [Mary]38-mary went down beside [him]54-dickon . [They]990-they had come upon a whole clump of crocuses burst into purple and orange and gold . [Mary]38-mary bent [her]38-mary face down and kissed and kissed [them]991-them .

" [You]54-dickon never kiss [a person]483-a person in that way , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said when [she]38-mary lifted [her]38-mary head . " Flowers are so different . "[38-mary]

[He]54-dickon looked puzzled but smiled .

" [Eh]2678-eh ! "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon said , " [I]54-dickon 've kissed [mother]224-mother many a time that way when [I]54-dickon come in from [th ' moor]1874-th ' moor after a day 's roamin ' an ' [she]224-mother stood there at th ' door in th ' sun , lookin ' so glad an ' comfortable . "[54-dickon] [They]990-they ran from one part of [the garden]146-the garden to another and found so many wonders that [they]990-they were obliged to remind [themselves]990-they that [they]990-they must whisper or speak low . [He]54-dickon showed [her]38-mary swelling leafbuds on rose branches which had seemed dead . [He]54-dickon showed [her]38-mary ten thousand new green points pushing through the mould . [They]990-they put [their]990-they eager young noses close to the earth and sniffed its warmed springtime breathing ; [they]990-they dug and pulled and laughed low with rapture until [Mistress Mary]38-mary 's hair was as tumbled as [Dickon]54-dickon 's and [her]38-mary cheeks were almost as poppy red as [his]54-dickon .

There was every joy on earth in [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden that morning , and in the midst of [them]990-they came a delight more delightful than all , because it was more wonderful . Swiftly something flew across the wall and darted through the trees to a close grown corner , a little flare of red - breasted bird with something hanging from its beak . [Dickon]54-dickon stood quite still and put [his]54-dickon hand on [Mary]38-mary almost as if [they]990-they had suddenly found [themselves]990-they laughing in [a church]353-a church .

" [We]990-they munnot stir , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon whispered in broad [Yorkshire]50-martha . " [We]990-they munnot scarce breathe . [I]54-dickon knowed [he]54-dickon was mate - huntin ' when [I]54-dickon seed [him]54-dickon last . It 's [Ben Weatherstaff]57-ben weatherstaff 's robin . [He]54-dickon 's buildin ' [[his]54-dickon nest]2681-his nest . [He]54-dickon 'll stay here if [us]990-they do n't fight [him]54-dickon . "[54-dickon] [They]990-they settled down softly upon the grass and sat there without moving .

" [Us]990-they must n't seem as if [us]990-they was watchin ' [him]54-dickon too close , "[54-dickon] said [Dickon]54-dickon . " [He]54-dickon 'd be out with [us]990-they for good if [he]54-dickon got th ' notion [us]990-they was interferin ' now . [He]54-dickon 'll be a good bit different till all this is over . [He]54-dickon 's settin ' up housekeepin ' . [He]54-dickon 'll be shyer an ' readier to take things ill . [He]54-dickon 's got no time for visitin ' an ' gossipin ' . [Us]990-they must keep still a bit an ' try to look as if [us]990-they was grass an ' trees an ' bushes . Then when [he]54-dickon 's got used to seein ' [us]990-they [I]54-dickon 'll chirp a bit an ' [he]54-dickon 'll know [us'll]2682-us'll not be in [his]54-dickon way . "[54-dickon]

[Mistress Mary]38-mary was not at all sure that [she]38-mary knew , as [Dickon]54-dickon seemed to , how to try to look like grass and trees and bushes . But [he]54-dickon had said the queer thing as if it were the simplest and most natural thing in [the world]234-the world , and [she]38-mary felt it must be quite easy to [him]54-dickon , and indeed [she]38-mary watched [him]54-dickon for a few minutes carefully , wondering if it was possible for [him]54-dickon to quietly turn green and put out branches and leaves . But [he]54-dickon only sat wonderfully still , and when [he]54-dickon spoke dropped [his]54-dickon voice to such a softness that it was curious that [she]38-mary could hear [him]54-dickon , but [she]38-mary could .

" It 's part o ' th ' springtime , this nest - buildin ' is , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon said . " [I]54-dickon warrant it 's been goin' on in th ' same way every year since [th ' world]2220-th ' world was begun . [They]2684-they 've got [their]2684-they way o ' thinkin ' and doin' things an ' [a body]2333-a body had better not meddle . [You]2686-you can lose [a friend]2687-a friend in springtime easier than any other season if [you]2686-you 're too curious . "[54-dickon]

" If [we]2688-we talk about [him]54-dickon [I]38-mary ca n't help looking at [him]54-dickon , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary said as softly as possible . " [We]2688-we must talk of something else . There is something [I]38-mary want to tell [you]2686-you . "[38-mary]

" [He]54-dickon 'll like it better if [us]2688-we talks o ' somethin' else , "[54-dickon] said [Dickon]54-dickon . " What is it [tha]54-dickon 's got to tell [me]54-dickon ? "[54-dickon]

" Well do [you]54-dickon know about [Colin]81-colin ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary whispered .

[He]54-dickon turned [his]54-dickon head to look at [her]38-mary .

" What does [tha]54-dickon ' know about [him]81-colin ? "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon asked .

" [I]38-mary 've seen [him]81-colin . [I]38-mary have been to talk to [him]81-colin every day this week . [He]81-colin wants [me]38-mary to come . [He]81-colin says [I]38-mary 'm making [him]81-colin forget about being ill and dying , "[38-mary] answered [Mary]38-mary .

[Dickon]54-dickon looked actually relieved as soon as the surprise died away from [his]54-dickon round face .

" [I]54-dickon am glad [o]2689-o ' that , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon exclaimed . " [I]54-dickon 'm right down glad . It makes [me]54-dickon easier . [I]54-dickon knowed [I]54-dickon must say nothin' about [him]81-colin an ' [I]54-dickon do n't like havin' to hide things . "[54-dickon]

" Do n't [you]54-dickon like hiding [the garden]146-the garden ? "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

" [I]54-dickon 'll never tell about it , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon answered . " But [I]54-dickon says to [mother]224-mother , ' [Mother]53-mother , ' [I]54-dickon says , ' [I]54-dickon got a secret to keep . It 's not a bad ' un , [tha ']2692-tha ' knows that . It 's no worse than hidin ' where a bird 's nest is . [Tha]2692-tha ' ' does n't mind it , does [tha]2692-tha ' ' ? ' "[54-dickon]

[Mary]38-mary always wanted to hear about [mother]224-mother .

" What did [she]224-mother say ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary asked , not at all afraid to hear .

[Dickon]54-dickon grinned sweet - temperedly .

" It was just like [her]224-mother , what [she]224-mother said , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon answered . " [She]224-mother give [my]54-dickon head a bit of a rub an ' laughed an ' [she]224-mother says , ' Eh , [lad]2693-lad , [tha]2692-tha ' ' can have all th ' secrets [tha]2692-tha ' ' likes . [I]54-dickon 've knowed [thee]2692-tha ' twelve year ' . ' "[54-dickon]

" How did [you]54-dickon know about [Colin]81-colin ? "[38-mary] asked [Mary]38-mary .

" [Everybody]185-everybody as knowed about [Mester Craven]89-mester craven knowed there was [a little lad as was like to be a cripple]2695-a little lad as was like to be a cripple , an ' [they]185-everybody knowed [Mester Craven]89-mester craven did n't like [him]89-mester craven to be talked about . [Folks]2696-folks is sorry for [Mester Craven]89-mester craven because [Mrs. Craven]59-mrs. craven was such [a pretty young lady]2697-a pretty young lady an ' [they]2696-folks was so fond of [each other]241-each other . [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock stops in [[our]2699-us cottage]2017-our cottage whenever [she]45-mrs. medlock goes to [Thwaite]13-thwaite an ' [she]45-mrs. medlock does n't mind talkin ' to [mother]224-mother before [[us]2699-us children]2702-us children , because [she]45-mrs. medlock knows [us]2699-us has been brought up to be trusty . How did tha ' find out about [him]89-mester craven ? [Martha]50-martha was in fine trouble th ' last time [she]50-martha came [home]1785-home . [She]50-martha said tha'd heard [him]89-mester craven frettin ' an ' [tha]50-martha ' was askin ' questions an ' [she]50-martha did n't know what to say . "[997-him]

[Mary]38-mary told [him]997-him [her]38-mary story about the midnight wuthering of the wind which had wakened [her]38-mary and about the faint far - off sounds of the complaining voice which had led [her]38-mary down [the dark corridors]998-the dark corridors with [her]38-mary candle and had ended with [her]38-mary opening of the door of [the dimly lighted room]999-the dimly lighted room with the carven four - posted bed in the corner . When [she]38-mary described the small ivory - white face and the strange black - rimmed eyes [Dickon]54-dickon shook [his]54-dickon head .

" [Them]2704-them 's just like [[his]89-mester craven mother]2546-his mother 's eyes , only [hers]2546-his mother was always laughin ' , [they]2704-them say , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon said . " [They]2704-them say as [Mr. Craven]41-mr. craven ca n't bear to see [him]89-mester craven when [he]89-mester craven 's awake an ' it 's because [his]89-mester craven eyes is so like [[his]89-mester craven mother]2546-his mother 's an ' yet looks so different in [his]89-mester craven miserable bit of a face . "[54-dickon]

" Do [you]54-dickon think [he]89-mester craven wants to die ? "[38-mary] whispered [Mary]38-mary .

" No , but [he]89-mester craven wishes [he]89-mester craven 'd never been born . [Mother]53-mother [she]53-mother says that 's th ' worst thing on [earth]2080-earth for [a child]1768-a child . [Them]2704-them as is not wanted scarce ever thrives . [Mester Craven]89-mester craven [he]89-mester craven 'd buy anythin ' as money could buy for [[th]2709-th ' poor lad]2710-th ' poor lad but [he]89-mester craven 'd like to forget as [he]89-mester craven 's on [earth]2080-earth . For one thing , [he]89-mester craven 's afraid [he]89-mester craven 'll look at [him]89-mester craven some day and find [he]89-mester craven 's growed hunchback . "[54-dickon]

" [Colin]81-colin 's so afraid of it [himself]81-colin that [he]81-colin wo n't sit up , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " [He]81-colin says [he]81-colin 's always thinking that if [he]81-colin should feel a lump coming [he]81-colin should go crazy and scream [himself]81-colin to death . "[38-mary]

" Eh ! [he]81-colin ought n't to lie there thinkin ' things like that , "[54-dickon] said [Dickon]54-dickon . " [No lad]2712-no lad could get well as thought them sort o ' things . "[54-dickon]

The fox was lying on the grass close by [him]54-dickon , looking up to ask for a pat now and then , and [Dickon]54-dickon bent down and rubbed [his]54-dickon neck softly and thought a few minutes in silence . Presently [he]54-dickon lifted [his]54-dickon head and looked round [the garden]146-the garden .

" When first [we]2713-we got in [here]1771-here , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon said , " it seemed like everything was gray . Look round now and tell [me]54-dickon if tha ' does n't see a difference . "[54-dickon]

[Mary]38-mary looked and caught [her]38-mary breath a little .

" Why ! "[38-mary] [she]38-mary cried , " the gray wall is changing . It is as if a green mist were creeping over it . It 's almost like a green gauze veil . "[38-mary]

" Aye , "[54-dickon] said [Dickon]54-dickon . " An ' it 'll be greener and greener till th ' gray 's all gone . Can tha ' guess what [I]54-dickon was thinkin ' ? "[54-dickon]
