" [I]38-mary know it was something nice , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary eagerly . " [I]38-mary believe it was something about [Colin]81-colin . "[38-mary]

" [I]54-dickon was thinkin ' that if [he]81-colin was out [here]1771-here [he]81-colin would n't be watchin ' for lumps to grow on [his]81-colin back ; [he]81-colin 'd be watchin ' for buds to break on th ' rose - bushes , an ' [he]81-colin 'd likely be healthier , "[54-dickon] explained [Dickon]54-dickon . " [I]54-dickon was wonderin ' if [us]2716-us could ever get [him]81-colin in [th ' humor]2717-th ' humor to come out here an ' lie under th ' trees in [[his]81-colin carriage]2718-his carriage . "[54-dickon]

" [I]38-mary 've been wondering that [myself]38-mary . [I]38-mary 've thought of it almost every time [I]38-mary 've talked to [him]81-colin , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " [I]38-mary 've wondered if [he]81-colin could keep a secret and [I]38-mary 've wondered if [we]2716-us could bring [him]81-colin here without [any one]189-any one seeing [us]2716-us . [I]38-mary thought perhaps [you]54-dickon could push [his]81-colin carriage . [The doctor]2517-the doctor said [he]81-colin must have fresh air and if [he]81-colin wants [us]2716-us to take [him]81-colin out [no one]145-no one dare disobey [him]81-colin . [He]81-colin wo n't go out for [other people]273-other people and perhaps [they]273-other people will be glad if [he]81-colin will go out with [us]2716-us . [He]81-colin could order [the gardeners]902-the gardeners to keep away so [they]902-the gardeners would n't find out . "[38-mary]

[Dickon]54-dickon was thinking very hard as [he]54-dickon scratched [Captain]2672-captain 's back .

" It 'd be good for [him]81-colin , [I]54-dickon 'll warrant , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon said . " [Us'd]2716-us not be thinkin ' [he]81-colin 'd better never been born . [Us'd]2716-us be just [two children]2724-two children watchin ' [a garden]245-a garden grow , an ' [he]81-colin 'd be another . [Two lads]2726-two lads an ' [a little lass just lookin ' on at th ' springtime]2727-a little lass just lookin ' on at th ' springtime . [I]54-dickon warrant it 'd be better than [doctor]2728-doctor 's stuff . "[54-dickon]

" [He]81-colin 's been lying in [[his]81-colin room]2556-his room so long and [he]81-colin 's always been so afraid of [his]81-colin back that it has made [him]81-colin queer , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " [He]81-colin knows a good many things out of books but [he]81-colin does n't know anything else . [He]81-colin says [he]81-colin has been too ill to notice things and [he]81-colin hates going out of doors and hates [gardens]1837-gardens and [gardeners]2731-gardeners . But [he]81-colin likes to hear about [this garden]2262-this garden because it is a secret . [I]38-mary dare n't tell [him]81-colin much but [he]81-colin said [he]81-colin wanted to see it . "[38-mary]

" Us'll have [him]81-colin out here sometime for sure , "[54-dickon] said [Dickon]54-dickon . " [I]54-dickon could push [his]81-colin carriage well enough . Has [tha]54-dickon ' noticed how th ' robin an ' [[his]81-colin mate]2733-his mate has been workin ' while [we]54-dickon 've been sittin ' [here]1771-here ? Look at [him]81-colin perched on that branch wonderin ' where it 'd be best to put that twig [he]81-colin 's got in [his]81-colin beak . "[54-dickon]

[He]54-dickon made one of [his]54-dickon low whistling calls and [the robin]495-the robin turned [his]495-the robin head and looked at [him]54-dickon inquiringly , still holding [his]495-the robin twig . [Dickon]54-dickon spoke to [him]495-the robin as [Ben Weatherstaff]57-ben weatherstaff did , but [Dickon]54-dickon 's tone was one of friendly advice .

" Wheres'ever tha ' puts it , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon said , " it 'll be all right . [Tha]54-dickon ' knew how to build [tha ' nest]2735-tha ' nest before [tha]54-dickon ' came out o ' th ' egg . Get on with [thee]495-the robin , [lad]2693-lad . [Tha'st]54-dickon got no time to lose . "[54-dickon]

" Oh , [I]38-mary do like to hear [you]54-dickon talk to [him]495-the robin ! "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary said , laughing delightedly . " [Ben Weatherstaff]57-ben weatherstaff scolds [him]495-the robin and makes fun of [him]495-the robin , and [he]495-the robin hops about and looks as if [he]495-the robin understood every word , and [I]38-mary know [he]495-the robin likes it . [Ben Weatherstaff]57-ben weatherstaff says [he]495-the robin is so conceited [he]495-the robin would rather have stones thrown at [him]495-the robin than not be noticed . "[38-mary]

[Dickon]54-dickon laughed too and went on talking .

" [Tha]54-dickon ' knows [us]54-dickon wo n't trouble [thee]54-dickon , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon said to [the robin]495-the robin . " [Us]54-dickon is near bein ' wild things [ourselves]54-dickon . [Us]54-dickon is nest - buildin ' too , bless [thee]54-dickon . Look out tha ' does n't tell on [us]54-dickon . "[54-dickon]

And though [the robin]495-the robin did not answer , because [his]495-the robin beak was occupied , [Mary]38-mary knew that when [he]495-the robin flew away with [his]495-the robin twig to [[his]495-the robin own corner of [the garden]146-the garden]1005-his own corner of the garden the darkness of [his]495-the robin dew - bright eye meant that [he]495-the robin would not tell [their]1007-their secret for [the world]234-the world .

CHAPTER XVI

" [I]38-mary WON'T ! "[38-mary] SAID [MARY]38-mary

[They]1007-their found a great deal to do that morning and [Mary]38-mary was late in returning to [the house]166-the house and was also in such a hurry to get back to [her]38-mary work that [she]38-mary quite forgot [Colin]81-colin until the last moment .

" Tell [Colin]81-colin that [I]38-mary ca n't come and see [him]81-colin yet , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said to [Martha]50-martha . " [I]38-mary 'm very busy in [the garden]146-the garden . "[38-mary]

[Martha]50-martha looked rather frightened .

" Eh ! [Miss Mary]38-mary , "[50-martha] [she]50-martha said , " it may put [him]81-colin all out of humor when [I]50-martha tell [him]81-colin that . "[50-martha]

But [Mary]38-mary was not as afraid of [him]81-colin as [other people]273-other people were and [she]38-mary was not [a self - sacrificing person]1011-a self - sacrificing person .

" [I]38-mary ca n't stay , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary answered . " [Dickon]54-dickon 's waiting for [me]38-mary ; "[38-mary] and [she]38-mary ran away .

The afternoon was even lovelier and busier than the morning had been . Already nearly all the weeds were cleared out of [the garden]146-the garden and most of the roses and trees had been pruned or dug about . [Dickon]54-dickon had brought a spade of [his]54-dickon own and [he]54-dickon had taught [Mary]38-mary to use all [her]38-mary tools , so that by this time it was plain that though [the lovely wild place]1013-the lovely wild place was not likely to become [a " [gardener]2348-gardener 's garden]2738-a " gardener 's garden "[54-dickon] it would be a wilderness of growing things before the springtime was over .

" There 'll be apple blossoms an ' cherry blossoms overhead , "[54-dickon] [Dickon]54-dickon said , working away with all [his]54-dickon might . " An ' there 'll be peach an ' plum trees in bloom against th ' walls , an ' th ' grass'll be a carpet o ' flowers . "[54-dickon]

[The little fox]1014-the little fox and the rook were as happy and busy as [they]1015-they were , and [the robin]495-the robin and [[his]495-the robin mate]2733-his mate flew backward and forward like tiny streaks of lightning . Sometimes the rook flapped [his]495-the robin black wings and soared away over the tree - tops in [the park]369-the park . Each time [he]495-the robin came back and perched near [Dickon]54-dickon and cawed several times as if [he]495-the robin were relating [his]495-the robin adventures , and [Dickon]54-dickon talked to [him]495-the robin just as [he]54-dickon had talked to [the robin]495-the robin . Once when [Dickon]54-dickon was so busy that [he]54-dickon did not answer [him]54-dickon at first , [Soot]61-soot flew on to [his]54-dickon shoulders and gently tweaked [his]54-dickon ear with [his]54-dickon large beak . When [Mary]38-mary wanted to rest a little [Dickon]54-dickon sat down with [her]38-mary under a tree and once [he]54-dickon took [his]54-dickon pipe out of [his]54-dickon pocket and played the soft strange little notes and two squirrels appeared on the wall and looked and listened .

" Tha 's a good bit stronger than tha ' was , "[54-dickon] [Dickon]54-dickon said , looking at [her]38-mary as [she]38-mary was digging . " [Tha]58-tha 's beginning to look different , for sure . "[54-dickon]

[Mary]38-mary was glowing with exercise and good spirits .

" [I]38-mary 'm getting fatter and fatter every day , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said quite exultantly . " [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock will have to get [me]38-mary some bigger dresses . [Martha]50-martha says [my]38-mary hair is growing thicker . It is n't so flat and stringy . "[38-mary]

The sun was beginning to set and sending deep gold - colored rays slanting under the trees when they parted .

" It 'll be fine tomorrow , "[54-dickon] said [Dickon]54-dickon . " [I]54-dickon 'll be at work by sunrise . "[54-dickon]

" So will [I]38-mary , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

[She]38-mary ran back to [the house]166-the house as quickly as [her]38-mary feet would carry [her]38-mary . [She]38-mary wanted to tell [Colin]81-colin about [Dickon]54-dickon 's fox cub and the rook and about what the springtime had been doing . [She]38-mary felt sure [he]81-colin would like to hear . So it was not very pleasant when [she]38-mary opened the door of [[her]38-mary room]1871-her room , to see [Martha]50-martha standing waiting for [her]38-mary with a doleful face .

" What is the matter ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary asked . " What did [Colin]81-colin say when [you]50-martha told [him]81-colin [I]38-mary could n't come ? "[38-mary]

" Eh ! "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha , " [I]50-martha wish tha'd gone . [He]81-colin was nigh goin' into one o ' [his]81-colin tantrums . There 's been a nice to do all afternoon to keep [him]81-colin quiet . [He]81-colin would watch the clock all th ' time . "[50-martha]

[Mary]38-mary 's lips pinched themselves together . [She]38-mary was no more used to considering [other people]273-other people than [Colin]81-colin was and [she]38-mary saw no reason why [an ill - tempered boy]1023-an ill - tempered boy should interfere with the thing [she]38-mary liked best . [She]38-mary knew nothing about the pitifulness of [people who had been ill and nervous]1024-people who had been ill and nervous and who did not know that [they]1024-people who had been ill and nervous could control [their]1024-people who had been ill and nervous tempers and need not make [other people ill and nervous]1025-other people ill and nervous , too . When [she]38-mary had had a headache in [India]2-india [she]38-mary had done [her]38-mary best to see that [everybody else]1026-everybody else also had a headache or something quite as bad . And [she]38-mary felt [she]38-mary was quite right ; but of course now [she]38-mary felt that [Colin]81-colin was quite wrong .

[He]81-colin was not on [his]81-colin sofa when [she]38-mary went into [[his]81-colin room]2556-his room . [He]81-colin was lying flat on [his]81-colin back in bed and [he]81-colin did not turn [his]81-colin head toward [her]38-mary as [she]38-mary came in . This was a bad beginning and [Mary]38-mary marched up to [him]81-colin with [her]38-mary stiff manner .

" Why did n't [you]81-colin get up ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said .

" [I]81-colin did get up this morning when [I]81-colin thought [you]38-mary were coming , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin answered , without looking at [her]38-mary . " [I]81-colin made [them]2740-them put [me]81-colin back in bed this afternoon . [My]81-colin back ached and [my]81-colin head ached and [I]81-colin was tired . Why did n't [you]81-colin come ? "[81-colin] " [I]38-mary was working in [the garden]146-the garden with [Dickon]54-dickon , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

[Colin]81-colin frowned and condescended to look at [her]38-mary .

" [I]81-colin wo n't let [that boy]2742-that boy come here if [you]38-mary go and stay with [him]2742-that boy instead of coming to talk to [me]81-colin , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said .

[Mary]38-mary flew into a fine passion . [She]38-mary could fly into a passion without making a noise . [She]38-mary just grew sour and obstinate and did not care what happened .

" If [you]81-colin send [Dickon]54-dickon away , [I]38-mary 'll never come into [this room]1872-this room again ! "[38-mary] [she]38-mary retorted .

" [You]38-mary 'll have to if [I]81-colin want [you]38-mary , "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin .

" [I]38-mary wo n't ! "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary .

" [I]81-colin 'll make [you]38-mary , "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin . " [They]2744-they shall drag [you]38-mary in . "[81-colin]

" Shall [they]2744-they , [Mr. Rajah]90-the rajah ! "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary fiercely . " [They]2744-they may drag [me]38-mary in but [they]2744-they ca n't make [me]38-mary talk when [they]2744-they get [me]38-mary here . [I]38-mary 'll sit and clench [my]38-mary teeth and never tell [you]38-mary one thing . [I]38-mary wo n't even look at [you]38-mary . [I]38-mary 'll stare at the floor ! "[38-mary]

[They]1028-they were a nice agreeable pair as [they]1028-they glared at [each other]241-each other . If [they]1028-they had been [two little street boys]1030-two little street boys [they]1028-they would have sprung at [each other]241-each other and had a rough - and - tumble fight . As it was , [they]1028-they did the next thing to it .

" [You]38-mary are a selfish thing ! "[81-colin] cried [Colin]81-colin .

" What are [you]81-colin ? "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " [Selfish people]2745-selfish people always say that . [Any one]189-any one is selfish who does n't do what [they]189-any one want . [You]38-mary 're more selfish than [I]38-mary am . [You]38-mary 're [the most selfish boy [I]38-mary ever saw]2747-the most selfish boy i ever saw . "[38-mary]

" [I]81-colin 'm not ! "[81-colin] snapped [Colin]81-colin . " [I]81-colin 'm not as selfish as [your]38-mary fine [Dickon]54-dickon is ! [He]54-dickon keeps [you]38-mary playing in the dirt when [he]54-dickon knows [I]81-colin am all by [myself]81-colin . [He]54-dickon 's selfish , if [you]38-mary like ! "[81-colin]

[Mary]38-mary 's eyes flashed fire .

" [He]54-dickon 's nicer than [any other boy that ever lived]2748-any other boy that ever lived ! "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " [He]54-dickon 's [he]54-dickon 's like [an angel]2749-an angel ! "[38-mary] It might sound rather silly to say that but [she]38-mary did not care .

" [A nice angel]2750-a nice angel ! "[81-colin] [Colin]81-colin sneered ferociously . " [He]54-dickon 's [a common cottage boy off [the moor]1835-the moor]2751-a common cottage boy off the moor ! "[81-colin]

" [He]54-dickon 's better than [a common Rajah]2753-a common rajah ! "[38-mary] retorted [Mary]38-mary . " [He]54-dickon 's a thousand times better ! "[38-mary]

Because [she]38-mary was the stronger of [the two]1032-the two [she]38-mary was beginning to get the better of [him]81-colin . The truth was that [he]81-colin had never had a fight with [any one like [himself]81-colin]1033-any one like himself in [his]81-colin life and , upon the whole , it was rather good for [him]81-colin , though neither [he]81-colin nor [Mary]38-mary knew anything about that . [He]81-colin turned [his]81-colin head on [his]81-colin pillow and shut [his]81-colin eyes and a big tear was squeezed out and ran down [his]81-colin cheek . [He]81-colin was beginning to feel pathetic and sorry for [himself]81-colin not for [any one else]1034-any one else .

" [I]81-colin 'm not as selfish as [you]38-mary , because [I]81-colin 'm always ill , and [I]81-colin 'm sure there is a lump coming on [my]81-colin back , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " And [I]81-colin am going to die besides . "[81-colin]

" [You]81-colin 're not ! "[38-mary] contradicted [Mary]38-mary unsympathetically .

[He]81-colin opened [his]81-colin eyes quite wide with indignation . [He]81-colin had never heard such a thing said before . [He]81-colin was at once furious and slightly pleased , if [a person]483-a person could be both at one time .

" [I]81-colin 'm not ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin cried . " [I]81-colin am ! [You]38-mary know [I]81-colin am ! [Everybody]185-everybody says so . "[81-colin]

" [I]38-mary do n't believe it ! "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary sourly . " [You]81-colin just say that to make [people]167-people sorry . [I]38-mary believe [you]81-colin 're proud of it . [I]38-mary do n't believe it ! If [you]81-colin were [a nice boy]2756-a nice boy it might be true but [you]81-colin 're too nasty ! "[38-mary]

In spite of [his]81-colin invalid back [Colin]81-colin sat up in bed in quite a healthy rage .

" Get out of [the room]201-the room ! "[81-colin] [he]81-colin shouted and [he]81-colin caught hold of [his]81-colin pillow and threw it at [her]38-mary . [He]81-colin was not strong enough to throw it far and it only fell at [her]38-mary feet , but [Mary]38-mary 's face looked as pinched as a nutcracker .

" [I]38-mary 'm going , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " And [I]38-mary wo n't come back ! "[38-mary] [She]38-mary walked to the door and when [she]38-mary reached it [she]38-mary turned round and spoke again .

" [I]38-mary was going to tell [you]81-colin all sorts of nice things , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " [Dickon]54-dickon brought [his]54-dickon fox and [[his]54-dickon rook]2758-his rook and [I]38-mary was going to tell [you]81-colin all about them . Now [I]38-mary wo n't tell [you]81-colin a single thing ! "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary marched out of the door and closed it behind [her]38-mary , and there to [her]38-mary great astonishment [she]38-mary found [the trained nurse]1036-the trained nurse standing as if [she]1036-the trained nurse had been listening and , more amazing still [she]1036-the trained nurse was laughing . [She]1036-the trained nurse was [a big handsome young woman who ought not to have been a trained nurse]1037-a big handsome young woman who ought not to have been a trained nurse at all , as [she]1036-the trained nurse could not bear [invalids]1038-invalids and [she]1036-the trained nurse was always making excuses to leave [Colin]81-colin to [Martha]50-martha or [any one else who would take [her]1036-the trained nurse place]1039-any one else who would take her place . [Mary]38-mary had never liked [her]1036-the trained nurse , and [she]38-mary simply stood and gazed up at [her]1036-the trained nurse as [she]38-mary stood giggling into [her]38-mary handkerchief ..

" What are [you]2532-the nurse laughing at ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary asked [her]1036-the trained nurse .

" At [[you]2532-the nurse two young ones]2759-you two young ones , "[2532-the nurse] said [the nurse]2532-the nurse . " It 's the best thing that could happen to [the sickly pampered thing]2760-the sickly pampered thing to have [some one]151-some one to stand up to [him]81-colin that 's as spoiled as [himself]81-colin ; "[2532-the nurse] and [she]2532-the nurse laughed into [her]2532-the nurse handkerchief again . " If [he]81-colin 'd had [a young vixen of [a sister to fight with it]2763-a sister to fight with it]2762-a young vixen of a sister to fight with it would have been the saving of [him]81-colin . "[2532-the nurse]

" Is [he]81-colin going to die ? "[2532-the nurse]

" [I]2532-the nurse do n't know and [I]2532-the nurse do n't care , "[2532-the nurse] said [the nurse]2532-the nurse . " Hysterics and temper are half what ails [him]81-colin . "[2532-the nurse]

" What are hysterics ? "[38-mary] asked [Mary]38-mary .

" [You]2532-the nurse 'll find out if [you]2532-the nurse work [him]81-colin into a tantrum after this but at any rate [you]2532-the nurse 've given [him]81-colin something to have hysterics about , and [I]2532-the nurse 'm glad of it . "[2532-the nurse]

[Mary]38-mary went back to [[her]38-mary room]1871-her room not feeling at all as [she]38-mary had felt when [she]38-mary had come in from [the garden]146-the garden . [She]38-mary was cross and disappointed but not at all sorry for [Colin]81-colin . [She]38-mary had looked forward to telling [him]81-colin a great many things and [she]38-mary had meant to try to make up [her]38-mary mind whether it would be safe to trust [him]81-colin with the great secret . [She]38-mary had been beginning to think it would be , but now [she]38-mary had changed [her]38-mary mind entirely . [She]38-mary would never tell [him]81-colin and [he]81-colin could stay in [[his]81-colin room]2556-his room and never get any fresh air and die if [he]81-colin liked ! It would serve [him]81-colin right ! [She]38-mary felt so sour and unrelenting that for a few minutes [she]38-mary almost forgot about [Dickon]54-dickon and the green veil creeping over [the world]234-the world and the soft wind blowing down from [the moor]1835-the moor .

[Martha]50-martha was waiting for [her]38-mary and the trouble in [her]38-mary face had been temporarily replaced by interest and curiosity . There was a wooden box on the table and its cover had been removed and revealed that it was full of neat packages .

" [Mr. Craven]41-mr. craven sent it to [you]38-mary , "[50-martha] said [Martha]50-martha . " It looks as if it had picture - books in it . "[50-martha]

[Mary]38-mary remembered what [he]81-colin had asked [her]38-mary the day [she]38-mary had gone to [[his]81-colin room]2556-his room . " Do [you]81-colin want anything dolls toys books ? "[81-colin] [She]38-mary opened the package wondering if [he]81-colin had sent a doll , and also wondering what [she]38-mary should do with it if [he]81-colin had . But [he]81-colin had not sent one . There were several beautiful books such as [Colin]81-colin had , and two of them were about [gardens]1837-gardens and were full of pictures . There were two or three games and there was a beautiful little writing - case with a gold monogram on it and a gold pen and inkstand .

Everything was so nice that [her]38-mary pleasure began to crowd [her]38-mary anger out of [her]38-mary mind . [She]38-mary had not expected [him]81-colin to remember [her]38-mary at all and [her]38-mary hard little heart grew quite warm .

" [I]38-mary can write better than [I]38-mary can print , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said , " and the first thing [I]38-mary shall write with that pen will be a letter to tell [him]81-colin [I]38-mary am much obliged . "[38-mary]

If [she]38-mary had been friends with [Colin]81-colin [she]38-mary would have run to show [him]81-colin [her]38-mary presents at once , and [they]1049-they would have looked at the pictures and read some of the gardening books and perhaps tried playing the games , and [he]81-colin would have enjoyed [himself]81-colin so much [he]81-colin would never once have thought [he]81-colin was going to die or have put [his]81-colin hand on [his]81-colin spine to see if there was a lump coming . [He]81-colin had a way of doing that which [she]38-mary could not bear . It gave [her]38-mary an uncomfortable frightened feeling because [he]81-colin always looked so frightened [himself]81-colin . [He]81-colin said that if [he]81-colin felt even quite a little lump some day [he]81-colin should know [his]81-colin hunch had begun to grow . Something [he]81-colin had heard [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock whispering to [the nurse]2532-the nurse had given [him]81-colin the idea and [he]81-colin had thought over it in secret until it was quite firmly fixed in [his]81-colin mind . [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock had said [[his]81-colin father]900-his father 's back had begun to show its crookedness in that way when [he]81-colin was [a child]1768-a child . [He]81-colin had never told [any one]189-any one but [Mary]38-mary that most of [his]81-colin " tantrums "[1054-they] as [they]1054-they called them grew out of [his]81-colin hysterical hidden fear . [Mary]38-mary had been sorry for [him]81-colin when [he]81-colin had told [her]38-mary .

" [He]81-colin always began to think about it when [he]81-colin was cross or tired , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said to [herself]38-mary . " And [he]81-colin has been cross today . Perhaps perhaps [he]81-colin has been thinking about it all afternoon . "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary stood still , looking down at the carpet and thinking .

" [I]38-mary said [I]38-mary would never go back again "[38-mary] [she]38-mary hesitated , knitting [her]38-mary brows " but perhaps , just perhaps , [I]38-mary will go and see if [he]81-colin wants [me]38-mary in the morning . Perhaps [he]81-colin 'll try to throw [his]81-colin pillow at [me]38-mary again , but [I]38-mary think [I]38-mary 'll go . "[38-mary]

CHAPTER XVII

A TANTRUM

[She]38-mary had got up very early in the morning and had worked hard in [the garden]146-the garden and [she]38-mary was tired and sleepy , so as soon as [Martha]50-martha had brought [her]38-mary supper and [she]38-mary had eaten it , [she]38-mary was glad to go to bed . As [she]38-mary laid [her]38-mary head on the pillow [she]38-mary murmured to [herself]38-mary :

" [I]38-mary 'll go out before breakfast and work with [Dickon]54-dickon and then afterward [I]38-mary believe [I]38-mary 'll go to see [him]54-dickon . "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary thought it was the middle of the night when [she]38-mary was awakened by such dreadful sounds that [she]38-mary jumped out of bed in an instant . What was it what was it ? The next minute [she]38-mary felt quite sure [she]38-mary knew . Doors were opened and shut and there were hurrying feet in [the corridors]836-the corridors and [some one]151-some one was crying and screaming at the same time , screaming and crying in a horrible way .

" It 's [Colin]81-colin , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " [He]81-colin 's having one of those tantrums [the nurse]2532-the nurse called hysterics . How awful it sounds . "[38-mary]

As [she]38-mary listened to the sobbing screams [she]38-mary did not wonder that [people]167-people were so frightened that [they]167-people gave [him]151-some one [his]151-some one own way in everything rather than hear [them]167-people . [She]38-mary put [her]38-mary hands over [her]38-mary ears and felt sick and shivering .

" [I]38-mary do n't know what to do . [I]38-mary do n't know what to do , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary kept saying . " [I]38-mary ca n't bear it . "[38-mary]

Once [she]38-mary wondered if [he]151-some one would stop if [she]38-mary dared go to [him]151-some one and then [she]38-mary remembered how [he]151-some one had driven [her]38-mary out of [the room]201-the room and thought that perhaps the sight of [her]38-mary might make [him]151-some one worse . Even when [she]38-mary pressed [her]38-mary hands more tightly over [her]38-mary ears [she]38-mary could not keep the awful sounds out . [She]38-mary hated them so and was so terrified by [them]1060-them that suddenly [they]1060-them began to make [her]38-mary angry and [she]38-mary felt as if [she]38-mary should like to fly into a tantrum [herself]38-mary and frighten [him]151-some one as [he]151-some one was frightening [her]38-mary . [She]38-mary was not used to [any one]189-any one 's tempers but [her]38-mary own . [She]38-mary took [her]38-mary hands from [her]38-mary ears and sprang up and stamped [her]38-mary foot .

" [He]151-some one ought to be stopped ! [Somebody]2765-somebody ought to make [him]151-some one stop ! [Somebody]2765-somebody ought to beat [him]151-some one ! "[38-mary] [she]38-mary cried out .

Just then [she]38-mary heard feet almost running down [the corridor]583-the corridor and [her]38-mary door opened and [the nurse]2532-the nurse came in . [She]2532-the nurse was not laughing now by any means . [She]2532-the nurse even looked rather pale .

" [He]151-some one 's worked [himself]151-some one into hysterics , "[2532-the nurse] [she]2532-the nurse said in a great hurry . " [He]151-some one 'll do [himself]151-some one harm . [No one]145-no one can do anything with [him]151-some one . [You]38-mary come and try , like [a good child]2768-a good child . [He]151-some one likes [you]38-mary . "[2532-the nurse]

" [He]151-some one turned [me]38-mary out of [the room]201-the room this morning , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary , stamping [her]38-mary foot with excitement .

The stamp rather pleased [the nurse]2532-the nurse . The truth was that [she]2532-the nurse had been afraid [she]2532-the nurse might find [Mary]38-mary crying and hiding [her]38-mary head under the bed - clothes .

" That 's right , "[2532-the nurse] [she]2532-the nurse said . " [You]38-mary 're in the right humor . [You]38-mary go and scold [him]151-some one . Give [him]151-some one something new to think of . Do go , [child]2169-child , as quick as ever [you]38-mary can . "[2532-the nurse]

It was not until afterward that [Mary]38-mary realized that the thing had been funny as well as dreadful that it was funny that [all the grown - up people]1065-all the grown - up people were so frightened that [they]1065-all the grown - up people came to [a little girl]127-a little girl just because [they]1065-all the grown - up people guessed [she]127-a little girl was almost as bad as [Colin]81-colin [himself]81-colin .

[She]38-mary flew along [the corridor]583-the corridor and the nearer [she]38-mary got to the screams the higher [her]38-mary temper mounted . [She]38-mary felt quite wicked by the time [she]38-mary reached the door . [She]38-mary slapped it open with [her]38-mary hand and ran across [the room]201-the room to the four - posted bed .

" [You]38-mary stop ! "[38-mary] [she]38-mary almost shouted . " [You]38-mary stop ! [I]38-mary hate [you]38-mary ! [Everybody]185-everybody hates [you]38-mary ! [I]38-mary wish [everybody]185-everybody would run out of [the house]166-the house and let [you]38-mary scream [yourself]38-mary to death ! [You]38-mary will scream [yourself]38-mary to death in a minute , and [I]38-mary wish [you]38-mary would ! "[38-mary] [A nice sympathetic child]1069-a nice sympathetic child could neither have thought nor said such things , but it just happened that the shock of hearing them was the best possible thing for [this hysterical boy whom [no one]145-no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict .

[He]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict had been lying on [his]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict face beating [his]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict pillow with [his]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict hands and [he]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict actually almost jumped around , [he]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict turned so quickly at the sound of the furious little voice . [His]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict face looked dreadful , white and red and swollen , and [he]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict was gasping and choking ; but [savage little Mary]38-mary did not care an atom .

" If [you]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict scream another scream , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said , " [I]38-mary 'll scream too and [I]38-mary can scream louder than [you]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict can and [I]38-mary 'll frighten [you]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict , [I]38-mary 'll frighten [you]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict ! "[38-mary]

[He]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict actually had stopped screaming because [she]38-mary had startled [him]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict so . The scream which had been coming almost choked [him]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict . The tears were streaming down [his]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict face and [he]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict shook all over .

" [I]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict ca n't stop ! "[1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict] [he]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict gasped and sobbed . " [I]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict ca n't [I]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict ca n't ! "[1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict]

" [You]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict can ! "[38-mary] shouted [Mary]38-mary . " Half that ails [you]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict is hysterics and temper just hysterics hysterics hysterics ! "[38-mary] and [she]38-mary stamped each time [she]38-mary said it .

" [I]81-colin felt the lump [I]81-colin felt it , "[81-colin] choked out [Colin]81-colin . " [I]81-colin knew [I]81-colin should . [I]81-colin shall have a hunch on [my]81-colin back and then [I]81-colin shall die , "[81-colin] and [he]81-colin began to writhe again and turned on [his]81-colin face and sobbed and wailed but [he]81-colin did n't scream .

" [You]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict did n't feel a lump ! "[38-mary] contradicted [Mary]38-mary fiercely . " If [you]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict did it was only a hysterical lump . Hysterics makes lumps . There 's nothing the matter with [your]1070-this hysterical boy whom no one had ever dared to restrain or contradict horrid back nothing but hysterics ! Turn over and let [me]38-mary look at it ! "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary liked the word " hysterics "[38-mary] and felt somehow as if it had an effect on [him]81-colin . [He]81-colin was probably like [herself]38-mary and had never heard it before .

" [Nurse]2638-nurse , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary commanded , " come here and show [me]38-mary [his]81-colin back this minute ! "[38-mary]

[The nurse]2532-the nurse , [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock and [Martha]50-martha had been standing huddled together near the door staring at [her]38-mary , [their]1073-their mouths half open . [All three]1074-all three had gasped with fright more than once . [The nurse]2532-the nurse came forward as if [she]2532-the nurse were half afraid . [Colin]81-colin was heaving with great breathless sobs .

" Perhaps [he]81-colin [he]81-colin wo n't let [me]2532-the nurse , "[2532-the nurse] [she]2532-the nurse hesitated in a low voice .

[Colin]81-colin heard [her]2532-the nurse , however , and [he]81-colin gasped out between two sobs :

" Sh - show [her]2532-the nurse ! [She]2532-the nurse - she'll see then ! "[81-colin]

It was a poor thin back to look at when it was bared . Every rib could be counted and every joint of the spine , though [Mistress Mary]38-mary did not count them as [she]38-mary bent over and examined [them]1076-them with a solemn savage little face . [She]38-mary looked so sour and old - fashioned that [the nurse]2532-the nurse turned [her]2532-the nurse head aside to hide the twitching of [her]2532-the nurse mouth . There was just a minute 's silence , for even [Colin]81-colin tried to hold [his]81-colin breath while [Mary]38-mary looked up and down [his]81-colin spine , and down and up , as intently as if [she]38-mary had been [the great doctor from [London]4-london]1078-the great doctor from london .

" There 's not a single lump there ! "[2532-the nurse] [she]2532-the nurse said at last . " There 's not a lump as big as a pin except backbone lumps , and [you]81-colin can only feel them because [you]81-colin 're thin . [I]2532-the nurse 've got backbone lumps [myself]2532-the nurse , and they used to stick out as much as [yours]81-colin do , until [I]2532-the nurse began to get fatter , and [I]2532-the nurse am not fat enough yet to hide them . There 's not a lump as big as a pin ! If [you]81-colin ever say there is again , [I]2532-the nurse shall laugh ! "[2532-the nurse]

[No one]145-no one but [Colin]81-colin [himself]81-colin knew what effect those crossly spoken childish words had on [him]81-colin . If [he]81-colin had ever had any one to talk to about [his]81-colin secret terrors if [he]81-colin had ever dared to let [himself]81-colin ask questions if [he]81-colin had had [childish companions]1080-childish companions and had not lain on [his]81-colin back in [the huge closed house]1081-the huge closed house , breathing an atmosphere heavy with the fears of [people who were [most of [them]1082-people who were most of them ignorant and tired of him ignorant and tired of [him]81-colin]1083-most of them ignorant and tired of him]1082-people who were most of them ignorant and tired of him , [he]81-colin would have found out that most of [his]81-colin fright and illness was created by [himself]81-colin . But [he]81-colin had lain and thought of [himself]81-colin and [his]81-colin aches and weariness for hours and days and months and years . And now that [an angry unsympathetic little girl]1084-an angry unsympathetic little girl insisted obstinately that [he]81-colin was not as ill as [he]81-colin thought [he]81-colin was [he]81-colin actually felt as if [she]1084-an angry unsympathetic little girl might be speaking the truth .

" [I]2532-the nurse did n't know , "[2532-the nurse] ventured [the nurse]2532-the nurse , " that [he]81-colin thought [he]81-colin had a lump on [his]81-colin spine . [His]81-colin back is weak because [he]81-colin wo n't try to sit up . [I]2532-the nurse could have told [him]81-colin there was no lump there . "[2532-the nurse] [Colin]81-colin gulped and turned [his]81-colin face a little to look at [her]2532-the nurse .

" C - could [you]2532-the nurse ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said pathetically .

" Yes , [sir]2395-sir . "[2532-the nurse]

" There ! "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary , and [she]38-mary gulped too .

[Colin]81-colin turned on [his]81-colin face again and but for [his]81-colin long - drawn broken breaths , which were the dying down of [his]81-colin storm of sobbing , [he]81-colin lay still for a minute , though great tears streamed down [his]81-colin face and wet the pillow . Actually the tears meant that a curious great relief had come to [him]81-colin . Presently [he]81-colin turned and looked at [the nurse]2532-the nurse again and strangely enough [he]81-colin was not like [a Rajah]2596-a rajah at all as [he]81-colin spoke to [her]2532-the nurse .

" Do [you]2532-the nurse think [I]81-colin could live to grow up ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said .

[The nurse]2532-the nurse was neither clever nor soft - hearted but [she]2532-the nurse could repeat some of [the London doctor]1089-the london doctor 's words .

" [You]81-colin probably will if [you]81-colin will do what [you]81-colin are told to do and not give way to [your]81-colin temper , and stay out a great deal in the fresh air . "[2532-the nurse]

[Colin]81-colin 's tantrum had passed and [he]81-colin was weak and worn out with crying and this perhaps made [him]81-colin feel gentle . [He]81-colin put out [his]81-colin hand a little toward [Mary]38-mary , and [I]0-i am glad to say that , [her]38-mary own tantum having passed , [she]38-mary was softened too and met [him]81-colin half - way with [her]38-mary hand , so that it was a sort of making up .

" [I]81-colin 'll [I]81-colin 'll go out with [you]38-mary , [Mary]38-mary , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " [I]81-colin sha n't hate fresh air if [we]2776-we can find "[81-colin] [He]81-colin remembered just in time to stop [himself]81-colin from saying " if [we]2776-we can find [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden "[81-colin] and [he]81-colin ended , " [I]81-colin shall like to go out with [you]38-mary if [Dickon]54-dickon will come and push [my]81-colin chair . [I]81-colin do so want to see [Dickon]54-dickon and the fox and the crow . "[81-colin]

[The nurse]2532-the nurse remade the tumbled bed and shook and straightened the pillows . Then [she]2532-the nurse made [Colin]81-colin a cup of beef tea and gave a cup to [Mary]38-mary , who really was very glad to get it after [her]38-mary excitement . [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock and [Martha]50-martha gladly slipped away , and after everything was neat and calm and in order [the nurse]2532-the nurse looked as if [she]2532-the nurse would very gladly slip away also . [She]2532-the nurse was [a healthy young woman]1092-a healthy young woman who resented being robbed of [her]2532-the nurse sleep and [she]2532-the nurse yawned quite openly as [she]2532-the nurse looked at [Mary]38-mary , who had pushed [her]38-mary big footstool close to the four - posted bed and was holding [Colin]81-colin 's hand .

" [You]38-mary must go back and get [your]38-mary sleep out , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " [He]81-colin 'll drop off after a while if [he]81-colin 's not too upset . Then [I]38-mary 'll lie down [myself]38-mary in [the next room]2585-the next room . "[38-mary]

" Would [you]81-colin like [me]38-mary to sing [you]81-colin that song [I]38-mary learned from [my]38-mary Ayah ? "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary whispered to [Colin]81-colin .

[His]81-colin hand pulled [hers]38-mary gently and [he]81-colin turned [his]81-colin tired eyes on [her]38-mary appealingly .

" Oh , yes ! "[81-colin] [he]81-colin answered . " It 's such a soft song . [I]81-colin shall go to sleep in a minute . "[81-colin]

" [I]38-mary will put [him]81-colin to sleep , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary said to [the yawning nurse]1093-the yawning nurse . " [You]1093-the yawning nurse can go if [you]1093-the yawning nurse like . "[38-mary]

" Well , "[2532-the nurse] said [the nurse]2532-the nurse , with an attempt at reluctance . " If [he]81-colin does n't go to sleep in half an hour [you]2532-the nurse must call [me]2532-the nurse . "[2532-the nurse]

" Very well , "[38-mary] answered [Mary]38-mary .

[The nurse]2532-the nurse was out of [the room]201-the room in a minute and as soon as [she]2532-the nurse was gone [Colin]81-colin pulled [Mary]38-mary 's hand again .

" [I]81-colin almost told , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said ; " but [I]81-colin stopped [myself]81-colin in time . [I]81-colin wo n't talk and [I]81-colin 'll go to sleep , but [you]2532-the nurse said [you]2532-the nurse had a whole lot of nice things to tell [me]81-colin . Have [you]2532-the nurse do [you]2532-the nurse think [you]2532-the nurse have found out anything at all about the way into [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden ? "[81-colin]

[Mary]38-mary looked at [his]81-colin poor little tired face and swollen eyes and [her]38-mary heart relented .

" [Ye]2532-the nurse - es , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary answered , " [I]38-mary think [I]38-mary have . And if [you]2532-the nurse will go to sleep [I]38-mary will tell [you]2532-the nurse tomorrow . "[38-mary] [His]81-colin hand quite trembled .

" Oh , [Mary]38-mary ! "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " Oh , [Mary]38-mary ! If [I]81-colin could get into it [I]81-colin think [I]81-colin should live to grow up ! Do [you]38-mary suppose that instead of singing the Ayah song [you]38-mary could just tell [me]81-colin softly as [you]38-mary did that first day what [you]38-mary imagine it looks like inside ? [I]81-colin am sure it will make [me]81-colin go to sleep . "[81-colin]

" Yes , "[38-mary] answered [Mary]38-mary . " Shut [your]81-colin eyes . "[38-mary]

[He]81-colin closed [his]81-colin eyes and lay quite still and [she]38-mary held [his]81-colin hand and began to speak very slowly and in a very low voice .

" [I]38-mary think it has been left alone so long that it has grown all into a lovely tangle . [I]38-mary think the roses have climbed and climbed and climbed until they hang from the branches and walls and creep over the ground almost like a strange gray mist . Some of [them]2780-them have died but many are alive and when the summer comes there will be curtains and fountains of roses . [I]38-mary think [the ground]2781-the ground is full of daffodils and snowdrops and lilies and iris working their way out of the dark . Now the spring has begun perhaps perhaps "[38-mary]

The soft drone of [her]38-mary voice was making [him]81-colin stiller and stiller and [she]38-mary saw it and went on .

" Perhaps [they]2780-them are coming up through the grass perhaps there are clusters of purple crocuses and gold ones even now . Perhaps the leaves are beginning to break out and uncurl and perhaps the gray is changing and a green gauze veil is creeping and creeping over everything . And the birds are coming to look at it because it is so safe and still . And perhaps perhaps perhaps "[38-mary] very softly and slowly indeed , " the robin has found [a mate]2782-a mate and is building a nest . "[38-mary]

And [Colin]81-colin was asleep .

CHAPTER XVIII

" THA ' [MUNNOT]16-munnot WASTE NO TIME "[38-mary]

Of course [Mary]38-mary did not waken early the next morning . [She]38-mary slept late because [she]38-mary was tired , and when [Martha]50-martha brought [her]38-mary breakfast [she]38-mary told [her]38-mary that though . [Colin]81-colin was quite quiet [he]81-colin was ill and feverish as [he]81-colin always was after [he]81-colin had worn [himself]81-colin out with a fit of crying . [Mary]38-mary ate [her]38-mary breakfast slowly as [she]38-mary listened .

" [He]81-colin says [he]81-colin wishes [tha]50-martha ' would please go and see [him]81-colin as soon as [tha]50-martha ' can , "[50-martha] [Martha]50-martha said . " It 's queer what a fancy [he]81-colin 's took to [thee]50-martha . [Tha]50-martha ' did give it [him]81-colin last night for sure did n't [tha]50-martha ? [Nobody else]2783-nobody else would have dared to do it . Eh ! [poor lad]2784-poor lad ! [He]2784-poor lad 's been spoiled till salt wo n't save [him]2784-poor lad . [Mother]53-mother says as [th]50-martha ' two worst things as can happen to [a child]1768-a child is never to have [his]1768-a child own way or always to have it . [She]53-mother does n't know which is [th]50-martha ' worst . [Tha]50-martha ' was in a fine temper tha'self , too . But [he]81-colin says to [me]50-martha when [I]50-martha went into [[his]81-colin room]2556-his room , ' Please ask [Miss Mary]38-mary if [she]38-mary 'll please come an ' talk to [me]50-martha ? ' Think o ' [him]81-colin saying please ! Will [you]38-mary go , [Miss]2787-miss ? "[50-martha] " [I]38-mary 'll run and see [Dickon]54-dickon first , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " No , [I]38-mary 'll go and see [Colin]81-colin first and tell [him]81-colin [I]38-mary know what [I]38-mary 'll tell [him]81-colin , "[38-mary] with a sudden inspiration .

[She]38-mary had [her]38-mary hat on when [she]38-mary appeared in [[Colin]81-colin 's room]1097-colin 's room and for a second [he]81-colin looked disappointed . [He]81-colin was in bed . [His]81-colin face was pitifully white and there were dark circles round [his]81-colin eyes .

" [I]81-colin 'm glad [you]38-mary came , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " [My]81-colin head aches and [I]81-colin ache all over because [I]81-colin 'm so tired . Are [you]38-mary going somewhere ? "[81-colin]

[Mary]38-mary went and leaned against [his]81-colin bed .

" [I]38-mary wo n't be long , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " [I]38-mary 'm going to [Dickon]54-dickon , but [I]38-mary 'll come back . [Colin]81-colin , it 's it 's something about [the garden]146-the garden . "[38-mary]

[His]81-colin whole face brightened and a little color came into it .

" Oh ! is it ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin cried out . " [I]81-colin dreamed about it all night [I]81-colin heard [you]38-mary say something about gray changing into green , and [I]81-colin dreamed [I]81-colin was standing in a place all filled with trembling little green leaves and there were birds on nests everywhere and they looked so soft and still . [I]81-colin 'll lie and think about it until [you]38-mary come back . "[81-colin]

In five minutes [Mary]38-mary was with [Dickon]54-dickon in [[their]1098-their garden]1099-their garden . The fox and the crow were with [him]54-dickon again and this time [he]54-dickon had brought two tame squirrels . " [I]54-dickon came over on the pony this mornin ' , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon said . " Eh ! [he]54-dickon is [a good little chap Jump]2789-a good little chap jump is ! [I]54-dickon brought these two in [my]54-dickon pockets . This here one [he]54-dickon 's called [Nut]61-soot an ' this here [other one]2790-other one 's called [Shell]61-soot . "[54-dickon]

When [he]54-dickon said " Nut "[54-dickon] one squirrel leaped on to [his]54-dickon right shoulder and when [he]54-dickon said " Shell "[54-dickon] [the other one]1100-the other one leaped on to [his]54-dickon left shoulder .

When [they]1098-their sat down on the grass with [Captain]47-captain curled at [their]1098-their feet , [Soot]61-soot solemnly listening on a tree and [Nut]61-soot and [Shell]61-soot nosing about close to [them]1098-their , it seemed to [Mary]38-mary that it would be scarcely bearable to leave such delightfulness , but when [she]38-mary began to tell [her]38-mary story somehow the look in [Dickon]54-dickon 's funny face gradually changed [her]38-mary mind . [She]38-mary could see [he]54-dickon felt sorrier for [Colin]81-colin than [she]38-mary did . [He]54-dickon looked up at the sky and all about [him]54-dickon .

" Just listen to [them]1098-their birds [th ' world]2220-th ' world seems full of 'em all whistlin ' an ' pipin ' , "[54-dickon] [he]54-dickon said . " Look at ['em]2792-'em dartin ' about , an ' hearken at 'em callin ' to each other . Come springtime seems like as if all th ' world 's callin ' . The leaves is uncurlin ' so [you]2793-you can see 'em an ' , [my]54-dickon word , th ' nice smells there is about ! "[54-dickon] sniffing with [his]54-dickon happy turned - up nose . " An ' [that poor lad]2794-that poor lad lyin ' shut up an ' seein ' so little that [he]2794-that poor lad gets to thinkin ' o ' things as sets [him]2794-that poor lad screamin ' . Eh ! [my]54-dickon ! [we]2795-we mun get [him]2794-that poor lad out here [we]2795-we mun get [him]2794-that poor lad watchin ' an listenin ' an ' sniffin ' up th ' air an ' get [him]2794-that poor lad just soaked through wi ' sunshine . An ' [we]2795-we munnot lose no time about it . "[54-dickon]

When [he]54-dickon was very much interested [he]54-dickon often spoke quite broad [Yorkshire]50-martha though at other times [he]54-dickon tried to modify [his]54-dickon dialect so that [Mary]38-mary could better understand . But [she]38-mary loved [his]54-dickon broad Yorkshire and had in fact been trying to learn to speak it [herself]38-mary . So [she]38-mary spoke a little now .

" Aye , that [we]2795-we mun , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said which meant " Yes , indeed , [we]2795-we must "[38-mary] . " [I]38-mary 'll tell [thee]54-dickon what [us'll]2795-we do first , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary proceeded , and [Dickon]54-dickon grinned , because when [the little wench]1101-the little wench tried to twist [her]38-mary tongue into speaking [Yorkshire]50-martha it amused [him]54-dickon very much . " [He]54-dickon 's took a graidely fancy to [thee]38-mary . [He]54-dickon wants to see [thee]38-mary and [he]54-dickon wants to see Soot an ' [Captain]47-captain . When [I]54-dickon go back to [the house]166-the house to talk to [him]54-dickon [I]54-dickon 'll ax [him]54-dickon if [tha]38-mary ' canna ' come an ' see [him]54-dickon tomorrow mornin ' an ' . bring [tha]38-mary ' creatures wi ' [thee]38-mary an ' then in a bit , when there 's more leaves out , an ' happen a bud or two , [we]38-mary 'll get [him]54-dickon to come out an ' [tha]38-mary ' shall push [him]54-dickon in [his]54-dickon chair an ' [we]38-mary 'll bring [him]54-dickon here an ' show [him]54-dickon everything . "[54-dickon]

When [she]1102-she stopped [she]1102-she was quite proud of [herself]1102-she . [She]1102-she had never made a long speech in [Yorkshire]50-martha before and [she]1102-she had remembered very well .

" Tha ' mun talk a bit o ' [Yorkshire]50-martha like that to [Mester Colin]81-colin , "[54-dickon] [Dickon]54-dickon chuckled . " [Tha'll]38-mary make [him]54-dickon laugh an ' there 's nowt as good for [ill folk]2797-ill folk as laughin ' is . [Mother]53-mother says [she]53-mother believes as half a hour 's good laugh every mornin ' ' ud cure a chap as was makin ' ready for typhus fever . "[54-dickon]

" [I]38-mary 'm going to talk [Yorkshire]50-martha to [him]54-dickon this very day , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary , chuckling [herself]38-mary .

[The garden]146-the garden had reached the time when every day and every night it seemed as if [Magicians]1104-magicians were passing through [it]146-the garden drawing loveliness out of [the earth]490-the earth and the boughs with wands . It was hard to go away and leave it all , particularly as [Nut]61-soot had actually crept on to [her]38-mary dress and [Shell]61-soot had scrambled down the trunk of the apple - tree [they]1106-they sat under and stayed there looking at [her]38-mary with inquiring eyes . But [she]38-mary went back to [the house]166-the house and when [she]38-mary sat down close to [Colin]81-colin 's bed [he]81-colin began to sniff as [Dickon]54-dickon did though not in such an experienced way .

" [You]38-mary smell like flowers and and fresh things , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin cried out quite joyously . " What is it [you]38-mary smell of ? It 's cool and warm and sweet all at the same time . "[81-colin]

" It 's th ' wind from [th ' moor]1874-th ' moor , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " It comes o ' sittin ' on th ' grass under a tree wi ' [Dickon]54-dickon an ' wi ' [Captain]2672-captain an ' Soot an ' [Nut]61-soot an ' Shell . It 's [th]2800-tha ' springtime an ' out o ' doors an ' sunshine as smells so graidely . "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary said it as broadly as [she]38-mary could , and [you]1108-you do not know how broadly [Yorkshire]50-martha sounds until [you]1108-you have heard [some one]151-some one speak it . [Colin]81-colin began to laugh .

" What are [you]38-mary doing ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said . " [I]81-colin never heard [you]38-mary talk like that before . How funny it sounds . "[81-colin]

" [I]38-mary 'm givin ' [thee]81-colin a bit o ' [Yorkshire]50-martha , "[38-mary] answered [Mary]38-mary triumphantly . " [I]38-mary canna ' talk as graidely as [Dickon]54-dickon an ' [Martha]50-martha can but [tha]2800-tha ' sees [I]38-mary can shape a bit . Eh ! [I]38-mary wonder tha'rt not ashamed o ' [thy]2800-tha face . "[38-mary]

And then [she]38-mary began to laugh too and [they]1110-they both laughed until [they]1110-they could not stop [themselves]1110-they and [they]1110-they laughed until [the room]201-the room echoed and [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock opening the door to come in drew back into [the corridor]583-the corridor and stood listening amazed .

" Well , upon [my]45-mrs. medlock word ! "[45-mrs. medlock] [she]45-mrs. medlock said , speaking rather broad [Yorkshire]50-martha [herself]45-mrs. medlock because there was [no one]145-no one to hear [her]45-mrs. medlock and [she]45-mrs. medlock was so astonished . " [Whoever]2803-whoever heard [th]2804-th ' like ! [Whoever on earth]2805-whoever on earth would ha ' thought it ! "[45-mrs. medlock]

There was so much to talk about . It seemed as if [Colin]81-colin could never hear enough of [Dickon]54-dickon and [Captain]2672-captain and [Soot and Nut and Shell]61-soot and the pony whose name was [Jump]92-jump . [Mary]38-mary had run round into the wood with [Dickon]54-dickon to see [Jump]92-jump . [He]92-jump was [a tiny little shaggy moor pony with thick locks hanging over [his]92-jump eyes and with a pretty face and a nuzzling velvet nose]1115-a tiny little shaggy moor pony with thick locks hanging over his eyes and with a pretty face and a nuzzling velvet nose . [He]81-colin was rather thin with living on moor grass but [he]81-colin was as tough and wiry as if the muscle in [his]81-colin little legs had been made of steel springs . [He]81-colin had lifted [his]81-colin head and whinnied softly the moment [he]81-colin saw [Dickon]54-dickon and [he]81-colin had trotted up to [him]81-colin and put [his]81-colin head across [his]81-colin shoulder and then [Dickon]54-dickon had talked into [his]81-colin ear and [Jump]92-jump had talked back in odd little whinnies and puffs and snorts . [Dickon]54-dickon had made [him]81-colin give [Mary]38-mary [his]81-colin small front hoof and kiss [her]38-mary on [her]38-mary cheek with [his]81-colin velvet muzzle .

" Does [he]81-colin really understand everything [Dickon]54-dickon says ? "[81-colin] [Colin]81-colin asked .

" It seems as if [he]81-colin does , "[38-mary] answered [Mary]38-mary . " [Dickon]54-dickon says anything will understand if [you]38-mary 're friends with it for sure , but [you]38-mary have to be [friends]1934-friends for sure . "[38-mary]

[Colin]81-colin lay quiet a little while and [his]81-colin strange gray eyes seemed to be staring at the wall , but [Mary]38-mary saw [he]81-colin was thinking .

" [I]81-colin wish [I]81-colin was friends with things , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said at last , " but [I]81-colin 'm not . [I]81-colin never had anything to be [friends with]2807-friends with , and [I]81-colin ca n't bear [people]167-people . "[81-colin]

" Ca n't [you]81-colin bear [me]38-mary ? "[38-mary] asked [Mary]38-mary .

" Yes , [I]81-colin can , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin answered . " It 's funny but [I]81-colin even like [you]38-mary . "[81-colin]

" [Ben Weatherstaff]57-ben weatherstaff said [I]38-mary was like [him]57-ben weatherstaff , "[38-mary] said [Mary]38-mary . " [He]57-ben weatherstaff said [he]57-ben weatherstaff 'd warrant [we]2809-we 'd both got the same nasty tempers . [I]38-mary think [you]38-mary are like [him]57-ben weatherstaff too . " Did [you]38-mary feel as if [you]38-mary hated [people]167-people ? "[81-colin]

[Colin]81-colin put out [his]81-colin thin hand and touched [her]38-mary .

" [Mary]38-mary , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said , " [I]81-colin wish [I]81-colin had n't said what [I]81-colin did about sending [Dickon]54-dickon away . " Well , it was rather funny to say it , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary admitted frankly , " because [his]54-dickon nose does turn up and [he]54-dickon has a big mouth and [his]54-dickon clothes have patches all over them and [he]54-dickon talks broad [Yorkshire]50-martha , but but if [an angel]2749-an angel did come to [Yorkshire]50-martha and live on [the moor]1835-the moor if there was [a Yorkshire angel]2814-a yorkshire angel [I]38-mary believe [he]54-dickon 'd understand the green things and know how to make them grow and [he]54-dickon would know how to talk to the wild creatures as [Dickon]54-dickon does and [they]2815-they 'd know [he]54-dickon was [friends]1934-friends for sure . "[38-mary]

" [I]81-colin should n't mind [Dickon]54-dickon looking at [me]81-colin , "[81-colin] said [Colin]81-colin ; " [I]81-colin want to see [him]54-dickon . "[81-colin]

" [I]38-mary 'm glad [you]81-colin said that , "[38-mary] answered [Mary]38-mary , " because because "[38-mary]

Quite suddenly it came into [her]38-mary mind that this was the minute to tell [him]81-colin . [Colin]81-colin knew something new was coming .

" Because what ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin cried eagerly .

[Mary]38-mary was so anxious that [she]38-mary got up from [her]38-mary stool and came to [him]81-colin and caught hold of both [his]81-colin hands .

" Can [I]38-mary trust [you]81-colin ? [I]38-mary trusted [Dickon]54-dickon because [birds]2817-birds trusted [him]54-dickon . Can [I]38-mary trust [you]81-colin for sure for sure ? "[38-mary] [she]38-mary implored .

[Her]38-mary face was so solemn that [he]81-colin almost whispered [his]81-colin answer .

" Yes yes ! "[38-mary]

" Well , [Dickon]54-dickon will come to see [you]81-colin tomorrow morning , and [he]54-dickon 'll bring [his]54-dickon creatures with [him]54-dickon . "[38-mary]

" Oh ! Oh ! "[81-colin] [Colin]81-colin cried out in delight .

" But that 's not all , "[38-mary] [Mary]38-mary went on , almost pale with solemn excitement . " The rest is better . There is a door into [the garden]146-the garden . [I]38-mary found it . It is under the ivy on the wall . "[38-mary]

If [he]81-colin had been [a strong healthy boy]1116-a strong healthy boy [Colin]81-colin would probably have shouted " Hooray ! Hooray ! Hooray ! "[81-colin] but [he]81-colin was weak and rather hysterical ; [his]81-colin eyes grew bigger and bigger and [he]81-colin gasped for breath .

" Oh ! [Mary]38-mary ! "[81-colin] [he]81-colin cried out with a half sob . " Shall [I]81-colin see it ? Shall [I]81-colin get into it ? Shall [I]81-colin live to get into it ? "[81-colin] and [he]81-colin clutched [her]38-mary hands and dragged [her]38-mary toward [him]81-colin .

" Of course [you]81-colin 'll see it ! "[38-mary] snapped [Mary]38-mary indignantly . " Of course [you]81-colin 'll live to get into it ! Do n't be silly ! "[38-mary]

And [she]38-mary was so un - hysterical and natural and childish that [she]38-mary brought [him]81-colin to [his]81-colin senses and [he]81-colin began to laugh at [himself]81-colin and a few minutes afterward [she]38-mary was sitting on [her]38-mary stool again telling [him]81-colin not what [she]38-mary imagined [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden to be like but what it really was , and [Colin]81-colin 's aches and tiredness were forgotten and [he]81-colin was listening enraptured .

" It is just what [you]38-mary thought it would be , "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said at last . " It sounds just as if [you]38-mary had really seen it . [You]38-mary know [I]81-colin said that when [you]38-mary told [me]81-colin first . "[81-colin]

[Mary]38-mary hesitated about two minutes and then boldly spoke the truth .

" [I]38-mary had seen it and [I]38-mary had been in , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " [I]38-mary found the key and got in weeks ago . But [I]38-mary dare n't tell [you]81-colin [I]38-mary dare n't because [I]38-mary was so afraid [I]38-mary could n't trust [you]81-colin for sure ! "[38-mary]

CHAPTER XIX

" IT HAS COME ! "[38-mary]

Of course [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven had been sent for the morning after [Colin]81-colin had had [his]81-colin tantrum . [He]86-dr. craven was always sent for at once when such a thing occurred and [he]86-dr. craven always found , when [he]86-dr. craven arrived , [a white shaken boy]1118-a white shaken boy lying on [his]1118-a white shaken boy bed , sulky and still so hysterical that [he]1118-a white shaken boy was ready to break into fresh sobbing at the least word . In fact , [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven dreaded and detested the difficulties of these visits . On this occasion [he]86-dr. craven was away from [Misselthwaite Manor]1-misselthwaite manor until afternoon .

" How is [he]1118-a white shaken boy ? "[86-dr. craven] [he]86-dr. craven asked [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock rather irritably when [he]86-dr. craven arrived . " [He]1118-a white shaken boy will break a blood - vessel in one of those fits some day . [The boy]792-the boy is half insane with hysteria and self - indulgence . "[45-mrs. medlock]

" Well , [sir]2395-sir , "[45-mrs. medlock] answered [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock , " [you]2395-sir 'll scarcely believe [your]2395-sir eyes when [you]2395-sir see [him]1118-a white shaken boy . [That plain sour - faced child that 's almost as bad as [himself]1118-a white shaken boy]2821-that plain sour - faced child that 's almost as bad as himself has just bewitched [him]2395-sir . How [she]2821-that plain sour - faced child that 's almost as bad as himself 's done it there 's no telling . [The Lord]2822-the lord knows [she]2821-that plain sour - faced child that 's almost as bad as himself 's nothing to look at and [you]2395-sir scarcely ever hear [her]2821-that plain sour - faced child that 's almost as bad as himself speak , but [she]2821-that plain sour - faced child that 's almost as bad as himself did what none of [us]2823-us dare do . [She]2821-that plain sour - faced child that 's almost as bad as himself just flew at [him]2395-sir like a little cat last night , and stamped [her]2821-that plain sour - faced child that 's almost as bad as himself feet and ordered [him]2395-sir to stop screaming , and somehow [she]2821-that plain sour - faced child that 's almost as bad as himself startled [him]2395-sir so that [he]2395-sir actually did stop , and this afternoon well just come up and see , [sir]2395-sir . It 's past crediting . "[45-mrs. medlock]

The scene which [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven beheld when [he]86-dr. craven entered [[[his]86-dr. craven patient]944-his patient 's room]1120-his patient 's room was indeed rather astonishing to [him]86-dr. craven . " [I]86-dr. craven am sorry to hear [you]81-colin were ill last night , [[my]86-dr. craven boy]2632-my boy , "[86-dr. craven] [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven said a trifle nervously . [He]86-dr. craven was rather [a nervous man]1123-a nervous man .

" [I]81-colin 'm better now much better , "[81-colin] [Colin]81-colin answered , rather like [a Rajah]90-the rajah . " [I]90-the rajah 'm going out in [my]90-the rajah chair in a day or two if it is fine . [I]90-the rajah want some fresh air . "[90-the rajah]

[Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven sat down by [him]81-colin and felt [his]81-colin pulse and looked at [him]81-colin curiously .

[Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven felt rather alarmed . [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven had never made such a short stay after a " tantrum "[86-dr. craven] ; usually [he]86-dr. craven was obliged to remain a very long time and do a great many things . "[86-dr. craven]

" [She]45-mrs. medlock 's got a way with [her]45-mrs. medlock , has [Susan]54-dickon , "[45-mrs. medlock] [she]45-mrs. medlock went on quite volubly . [No one]145-no one owns more than [his]145-no one bit of a quarter an ' there 's times it seems like there 's not enow [quarters]1141-quarters to go round . But do n't [you]1142-you none o ' [you]1142-you think as [you]1142-you own [th]1143-th ' whole orange or [you]1142-you 'll find out [you]1142-you 're mistaken , an ' [you]1142-you wo n't find it out without hard knocks . " ' What [children]1816-children learns from [children]1816-children , ' [she]45-mrs. medlock says , ' is that there 's no sense in grabbin ' at th ' whole orange peel an ' all . If [you]1142-you do [you]1142-you 'll likely not get even th ' pips , an ' [them]1816-children 's too bitter to eat . ' "[1142-you]

" [She]45-mrs. medlock 's [a shrewd woman]2856-a shrewd woman , "[86-dr. craven] said [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven , putting on [his]86-dr. craven coat .

" Well , [she]45-mrs. medlock 's got a way of saying things , "[45-mrs. medlock] ended [Mrs. Medlock]45-mrs. medlock , much pleased . " Sometimes [I]45-mrs. medlock 've said to [her]45-mrs. medlock , ' Eh ! [Susan]54-dickon , if [you]54-dickon was [a different woman]2857-a different woman an ' did n't talk such broad Yorkshire [I]45-mrs. medlock 've seen the times when [I]45-mrs. medlock should have said [you]54-dickon was clever . ' "[45-mrs. medlock]

That night [Colin]81-colin slept without once awakening and when [he]81-colin opened [his]81-colin eyes in the morning [he]81-colin lay still and smiled without knowing it smiled because [he]81-colin felt so curiously comfortable . It was actually nice to be awake , and [he]81-colin turned over and stretched [his]81-colin limbs luxuriously . [He]81-colin felt as if tight strings which had held [him]81-colin had loosened themselves and let [him]81-colin go . [He]81-colin did not know that [Dr. Craven]86-dr. craven would have said that [his]81-colin nerves had relaxed and rested themselves . Instead of lying and staring at the wall and wishing [he]81-colin had not awakened , [his]81-colin mind was full of the plans [he]81-colin and [Mary]38-mary had made yesterday , of pictures of [the garden]146-the garden and of [Dickon]54-dickon and [his]54-dickon wild creatures . It was so nice to have things to think about . And [he]81-colin had not been awake more than ten minutes when [he]81-colin heard feet running along [the corridor]583-the corridor and [Mary]38-mary was at the door . The next minute [she]38-mary was in [the room]201-the room and had run across to [his]81-colin bed , bringing with [her]38-mary a waft of fresh air full of the scent of the morning .

" [You]38-mary 've been out ! [You]38-mary 've been out ! There 's that nice smell of leaves ! "[81-colin] [he]81-colin cried .

[She]38-mary had been running and [her]38-mary hair was loose and blown and [she]38-mary was bright with the air and pink - cheeked , though [he]81-colin could not see it .

" It 's so beautiful ! "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said , a little breathless with [her]38-mary speed . " [You]81-colin never saw anything so beautiful ! It has come ! [I]38-mary thought it had come that other morning , but it was only coming . It is here now ! It has come , the Spring ! [Dickon]54-dickon says so ! "[38-mary]

" Has it ? "[81-colin] cried [Colin]81-colin , and though [he]81-colin really knew nothing about it [he]81-colin felt [his]81-colin heart beat . [He]81-colin actually sat up in bed .

" Open the window ! "[81-colin] [he]81-colin added , laughing half with joyful excitement and half at [his]81-colin own fancy . " Perhaps [we]2858-we may hear golden trumpets ! "[81-colin]

And though [he]81-colin laughed , [Mary]38-mary was at the window in a moment and in a moment more it was opened wide and freshness and softness and scents and birds ' songs were pouring through .

" That 's fresh air , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary said . " Lie on [your]81-colin back and draw in long breaths of it . That 's what [Dickon]54-dickon does when [he]54-dickon 's lying on [the moor]1835-the moor . [He]54-dickon says [he]54-dickon feels it in [his]54-dickon veins and it makes [him]54-dickon strong and [he]54-dickon feels as if [he]54-dickon could live forever and ever . Breathe it and breathe it . "[38-mary]

[She]38-mary was only repeating what [Dickon]54-dickon had told [her]38-mary , but [she]38-mary caught [Colin]81-colin 's fancy .

" ' Forever and ever ' ! Does it make [him]81-colin feel like that ? "[81-colin] [he]81-colin said , and [he]81-colin did as [she]38-mary told [him]81-colin , drawing in long deep breaths over and over again until [he]81-colin felt that something quite new and delightful was happening to [him]81-colin .

[Mary]38-mary was at [his]81-colin bedside again .

" Things are crowding up out of [the earth]490-the earth , "[38-mary] [she]38-mary ran on in a hurry . " And there are flowers uncurling and buds on everything and the green veil has covered nearly all the gray and the birds are in such a hurry about [[their]2861-their nests]2862-their nests for fear [they]2861-their may be too late that some of [them]2861-their are even fighting for places in [the secret garden]1969-the secret garden . And the rose - bushes look as wick as wick can be , and there are primroses in [the lanes]2864-the lanes and woods , and the seeds [we]2865-we planted are up , and [Dickon]54-dickon has brought the fox and the crow and the squirrels and a new - born lamb . "[38-mary]

And then [she]38-mary paused for breath . The new - born lamb [Dickon]54-dickon had found three days before lying by [[its]1147-it dead mother]1148-its dead mother among the gorse bushes on [the moor]1835-the moor . It was not the first motherless lamb [he]54-dickon had found and [he]54-dickon knew what to do with it . [He]54-dickon had taken [it]1147-it to [the cottage]646-the cottage wrapped in [his]54-dickon jacket and [he]54-dickon had let [it]1147-it lie near the fire and had fed [it]1147-it with warm milk . It was a soft thing with a darling silly baby face and legs rather long for [its]1147-it body . [Dickon]54-dickon had carried it over [the moor]1835-the moor in [his]54-dickon arms and its feeding bottle was in [his]54-dickon pocket with a squirrel , and when [Mary]38-mary had sat under a tree with its limp warmness huddled on [her]38-mary lap [she]38-mary had felt as if [she]38-mary were too full of strange joy to speak . [A lamb]1152-a lamb [a lamb]1152-a lamb ! [A living lamb who lay on [your]1155-your lap like [a baby]2544-a baby]1154-a living lamb who lay on your lap like a baby !

[She]38-mary was describing it with great joy and [Colin]81-colin was listening and drawing in long breaths of air when [the nurse]2532-the nurse entered . [She]2532-the nurse started a little at the sight of the open window . [She]2532-the nurse had sat stifling in [the room]201-the room many a warm day because [[her]2532-the nurse patient]1159-her patient was sure that open windows gave [people]167-people cold .

" Are [you]81-colin sure [you]81-colin are not chilly , [Master Colin]81-colin ? "[2532-the nurse] [she]2532-the nurse inquired .

" No , "[2532-the nurse] was the answer . " [I]2532-the nurse am breathing long breaths of fresh air . It makes [you]81-colin strong . [I]2532-the nurse am going to get up to the sofa for breakfast . [[My]2532-the nurse cousin]2627-my cousin will have breakfast with [me]2532-the nurse . "[2532-the nurse]

[The nurse]2532-the nurse went away , concealing a smile , to give the order for two breakfasts . [She]2532-the nurse found [[the servants]162-the servants ' hall]1163-the servants ' hall a more amusing place than [[the invalid]1164-the invalid 's chamber]1165-the invalid 's chamber and just now [everybody]185-everybody wanted to hear the news from [upstairs]1884-upstairs . "[1171-the butler]

When [Colin]81-colin was on [his]81-colin sofa and the breakfast for two was put upon the table [he]81-colin made an announcement to [the nurse]2532-the nurse in [his]81-colin most Rajah - like manner .

" [A boy]155-a boy , and a fox , and a crow , and two squirrels , and a new - born lamb , are coming to see [me]81-colin this morning . " [I]81-colin 'll tell [you]2532-the nurse what [you]2532-the nurse can do , "[81-colin] added [Colin]81-colin , waving [his]81-colin hand .
